name: Englewood Cottage
summary: Enjoy a peaceful stay in part of a 1938 cottage one block from Englewood Park. The neighborhood is an easy mile or so by foot, car, bus, or pedicab to the Oregon State Capitol, Willamette University and downtown Salem and a half mile to the Oregon State Hospital. Consider flying into Portland, taking the Hut Shuttle Bus to the Salem Airport, riding in a pedicab, or your host's car, to your charming provisional Salem home. Transportation is available from the nearby Amtrak station as well.
space: These are cozy and artful private rooms: a bedroom, bathroom, and living room with access to a spacious and unique shared front porch.  There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and a comfortable futon couch that sleeps two in the living room.  A mini kitchenette is in the living room and it includes a small refrigerator, a water cooler that dispenses hot and cold water, a toaster oven, and hot plate. Simple nutritious breakfast foods (oats, bagels, hard boiled eggs, and fruit) are also provided along with coffee and tea and cocoa.  Englewood is a very peaceful and friendly neighborhood. The house is surrounded by gardens and nearby Englewood Park, the Jason Lee Cemetery, and the Oregon State Hospital grounds which provide pleasant places to stroll and watch the sun set, the moon rise. Disclaimers: Please note that while this is not an 'entire place/apt' it is more than a room. Airbnb doesn't have a way to designate this type of place...the rooms are connected to the main house and are

neighborhood_overview: Englewood is an old, charming and diverse, centrally located neighborhood surrounded by 200 foot Douglas Firs and Cedars.
notes: There are so many things to appreciate in this valley and in this town: agriculture, viticulture, the natural wonder of Silver Creek Falls State Park, Pacific Northwest native plants, terrific hikes very close to town, the carousel and Riverfront Park to name just a few. If you'd make your interests known ahead of time, your host will do her best to guide you.
transit: The Cherriots bus stop is 3 blocks away, the nearest grocery store is about half mile away...about 15 minutes by foot...and the Amtrak station is a mile from here. The Green Cab company (bicycle powered) will pick you up at the house and take you anywhere in Salem for whatever price you think is fair. The Hut Shuttle Bus, to and from Portland Airport, arrives nearby at the Salem Airport and, with notice, your host or The Green Cab Company is willing to provide transportation to and from there.
access: This is a house with two sections. You will have a private entrance with access to a private bedroom, a private small bathroom, a private living room, and a shared front porch. There are limited cooking facilities.
interaction: Your host, and occassionaly her 5 year old granddaughter, reside in the main house. We are pleased when you are here and welcome interaction with you if that is your preference too. It is not a requirement, however.
house_rules: quiet time between 10pm and 8am no smoking anywhere on the premises, no parties, no drugs.
host_about: I am an actively engaged, retired restaurant owner/operator and community college instructor who is raising her 5year old (charming and very easy to be with) granddaughter. No dogs live here at the moment but one may appear at any time.

name: Garden studio apt
summary: Light and roomy, opening onto garden, this apartment is private, quiet and secure. There are 2 sleeping or work areas in the large bedroom, a bookshelf-lined den, kitchen and bath, all separate rooms. Outdoor  patio and arbor . Close to downtown and to bike and walking trails. Special pricing available for monthly or longer stays.
space: Only an hour's drive from the Pacific coast, the Cascade mountains, or Portland's many food, brew, literary, hip culture attractions, Salem is easy to get around with plenty of historic buildings, parks and gardens, brewpubs and wineries. From the house you can walk or bike to all many services or stretch out and cross the river to downtown on the beautiful pedestrian bridge.   The downstairs suite of about 900 sq ft or +/- 100 sq m includes a large, dividable bedroom space with queen bed in one half and twin in the other.  Bath, kitchen, den and garden patio complete the spacious, quiet enjoyment indoors and out. Washer and dryer (shared with the host at agreed-upon times), Wi-Fi, offstreet parking.   Casual family neighborhood with minimal traffic.  Walking distance supermarket, bakery, coffee shops, library, restaurants, ice cream shops, etc.  Public transit about 5 blocks away.  Good spots for reading, many books and info on local sites and history on-hand. Fresh fruit in season. T

neighborhood_overview: There are 2 good-sized parks nearby, nice hilly neighborhoods and the ability to walk to most services, including a popular brewpub/distinctive Mexican eatery.  After your arrival here, it is not necessary to drive everywhere to enjoy this simple family neighborhood, and the greenness of the area.  Extended bike/walking paths lead across the river and south through green areas, with extended distance for a peaceful outdoors workout.
notes: Laundry facilities for the house are in the apartment.  As needed during an extended stay, the host will arrange for mutually convenient times to use the laundry.
transit: Uber and Lyft ride-share companies are now available in Salem.  The west side transit station is a 10 minute walk away.  Salem lacks weekend bus service so far. Buses can connect to the train and bus station or to the shuttles for Portland airport.  Several trains and buses travel between Portland, Salem and Eugene daily.
access: Guests have access to all spaces within the apartment, the patio, backyard and garage.
interaction: I always enjoy meeting guests upon arrival if at all possible to answer questions and let them  know they can follow up when they want. Then I usually respect their privacy unless they want more contact.  Sometimes we have long conversations or share a glass of wine, while other guests may chat only at the beginning and end of a visit.
house_rules: Quiet requested from 11 PM to 6 AM; no smoking.  Except for breakfast foods provided at arrival, the apartment is self-catering.  When you depart, please remove your food and leave the apartment as you found it.  You are invited to browse the library and read all you want, but leave my books when you go.  There is one shelf of trade books that you can add to or take from.   The house washer and dryer available; follow directions in the notebook. I will arrange times with guests when I do laundry. Let me know if you'd like to share a cup of coffee or glass of wine or even a meal and I am happy to join you when our schedules mesh.  Otherwise, I assume you'd prefer privacy.
host_about:
An avid traveler and lover of the outdoors, I teach English to non-native speakers at the community college in Salem.  Nowadays I do that parttime, making way for winter skiing,  summer hiking , road trips or river trips, music, reading and favorite small children.  History, gardening, poetry and literature, food, agriculture are some of my interests.  Turkey, Greece, Ukraine, Mexico, Switzerland and France are places I've traveled alone and spent at least 2-8weeks each.  In fact, staying in one place while exploring all around suits me better than continuous travel, and that's the experience I'd like to enable as a host.  From here, there are so many day trips: to the Pacific, to wineries of all sorts, cities north and south (Portland and Eugene), the Columbia Gorge and Mt Hood, waterfalls and forests, art galleries and museums.
One of my strengths is connecting folks with resources and opportunities.  At work, that's been my focus in helping newcomers with cultural adjustment.  Helping guests get the most from their time here appeals to me, but I also value independence and privacy, so knowing what they prefer can make a good stay for us both.

name: quiet room with a view
space: Quiet, roomy home with views toward the river and easy access to downtown Salem, or the highway to Cascade Mountains or Pacific beaches.  Roomy closet, comfortable double bed, desk; shared bathroom across the hall; living room, deck and kitchen all available.   Family neighborhood with low traffic and good neighbors close to conveniences and places of interest. A ten-minute walk brings you to coffee shops, quality grocery store, library, hardware, parks, restaurants, bookstore, transit mall, etc.  In fifteen more minutes you can walk to downtown Salem via the lovely pedestrian bridge across the Willamette River.  Bus service, bike paths or your car can take you to your destination or exploration.

neighborhood_overview: Located on an older non-through street of family houses with views of the foothills across the river, the neighborhood is quiet and friendly. A 10 minute walk leads to a large park with stream, natural hillside, playground and walking paths. Or 15 minutes the other way leads to a very large park along the Willamette River and connection to miles of bike and walking paths.  A quality supermarket with extensive deli cafe,  coffee shops, restaurant, banks, post office, library and more are all walking distance.
transit: The West Salem transit mall or a bus stop are each about 10-15 minutes by foot.  Downtown can also be reached on foot or bicycle mostly on a designated pathway. Parking available either on or off street.
access: Kitchen, bathroom, living and dining room, deck above garden, front porch and front yard.

name: Spacious Flat in Historic Home
summary: This lovely 1 1/2 bedroom apartment is tucked between our historic home and my painting studio in the heart of Salem. Cello music can resonate through the walls while you prepare a meal in the kitchen or relax in your comfy living room!
space: There are so many sweet details in this charming flat:  a very nice  little kitchen, a large living room, a newly remodeled bathroom and the bedroom has a Full Bed with an optional twin bed in an adjoining half room.  This is ideal for small families and close friends.  The quiet Englewood neighborhood is in the heart of the Willamette valley and you will see a small sampling of my paintings throughout the space.   The kitchen is supplied with dishes and pans, a stove, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, blender and my favorite take out menu's and pizza deliveries.    Off street parking  is available next to the studio. A private entrance accessed through a nicely landscaped yard.  Your hosts are a family of four;  a retired builder, an acrylic painter and a high school student who plays a lovely cello and a six year old.  We have a dog named Snickers and a cat named Winnie. We love meeting everyone who stays in the flat and happy to share area details and answer your questions. Once you

neighborhood_overview: We live in a lovely old neighborhood where people walk the dogs and stop to say hello.  The Englewood neighborhood park is just steps away. The flat is minutes from downtown, the State Capital, Hallie Ford Museum of Art and Willamette University.
notes: The Willamette valley is gorgeous, with an abundance of trees, fruits, vegetables and many parks.  Salem is  45 miles south of Portland and the lush Willamette Valley lays between the Pacific Ocean and the Cascade Mountains, hosting Silver Falls State Park.
transit: The bus line runs Monday through Friday and the bus stops 2 blocks away.  A convenience  store is a four block walk and a grocery is a mile.  We are happy to offer transportation to a from the train station if our schedule allows.
access: Off street parking  is available next to the studio. A private entrance accessed through a nicely landscaped yard.
interaction: Your hosts are a family of four;  a retired builder, an acrylic painter and a high school student who plays a lovely cello and a six year old.  We have a dog named Snickers and a cat named Winnie. We love meeting everyone who stays in the flat and happy to share area details and answer your questions. Once you are settled in we are available if needed as we carry on with our busy lives. Rest assured that we will respect your privacy.
house_rules: Please enjoy yourselves and be comfortable.  Since the Flat is connected to our home, our quiet hours are from 11 PM to 7 AM.  No smoking,  or incense please, the house was built in 1891!  Sorry we no longer accept traveling Pets!
host_about:
We moved into this Historic home in 2005, living in the flat you see on Air bnb.  The house had been divided into 3 apartments which we slowly restored (my husband Curt has never run out of work)! I am an artist with a studio space over the garage where I work in acrylic paint systems.  Our daughter is in high school and graces our home with wonderful music with her cello and piano.
We love living in this neighborhood, family, friends, art, music, history and people who laugh, smile and enjoy life.

access: Guests will have access to the kitchen, family room, living room and dining room.  As well as a beautiful deck and hot tub.  There is a new HDTV in the guests room if you do not wish to watch TV in the family room.
interaction: I should be here most of them time as I retired two years ago.  I currently have 1 dog and 2 cats.   I'd like to rent my rooms out for the lunar eclipse on August 21, 2017 only.
house_rules: No smoking of any kind No fragrance of any kind - I'm an asthmatic and my baby dog is allergic - makes him sneeze. No coming and going all night long Please keep the bathroom neat and tidy as well as your room No loud music - enjoy the peace and quiet No extra guests spending the night
host_about:
Hi - I have been retired for two years and am enjoying life.  I live with my fur kids - Duncan, a lovable flat coated retriever and  1 cat.  I have a lovely home where you can enjoy the deck, the yard and the hot tub.  I live on top of a hill with lovely views.  

I will be at home when you are here and you are welcome to join me in the family to watch TV, read a book or chat.  You are also welcome to use the kitchen, please ask for assistance.  I have a Keurig for those of you that drink coffee - I enjoy my morning cup.

Looking forward to making some new friends.

Thank you,
Roberta

name: Quiet and cozy home in South Salem.
summary: This cozy, tidy, and well kept home is located in the south Salem hills away from the hustle and bustle.  The home is easily accessible to the downtown area, close to shops, parks, restaurants.  Enjoy the quiet, trees, birds, on two private decks.
space: My home is nestled in a wooded area within the city limits, however, the setting is rural and quiet.  Guests have a private bedroom and bathroom.  The large windows throughout the home provide natural light with excellent views of nature and outdoor critters.
description: This cozy, tidy, and well kept home is located in the south Salem hills away from the hustle and bustle.  The home is easily accessible to the downtown area, close to shops, parks, restaurants.  Enjoy the quiet, trees, birds, on two private decks.    My home is nestled in a wooded area within the city limits, however, the setting is rural and quiet.  Guests have a private bedroom and bathroom.  The large windows throughout the home provide natural light with excellent views of nature and outdoor critters. Guests have access to the main living area, kitchen, laundry, private bedroom and bathroom, large closet, two decks, and Wifi. I will be present to meet guests upon arrival and assist them in getting settled and oriented to the home.  I do work full time but usually home in the evenings and weekend.  I live in a great neighborhood and have been here for about 30 years.  I love the outdoor area as well as my close proximity to the main downtown area.  Downtown Salem has many locally ow
neighborhood_overview: I live in a great neighborhood and have been here for about 30 years.  I love the outdoor area as well as my close proximity to the main downtown area.  Downtown Salem has many locally owned restaurants and night spots.  I am also very close to Willamette University.  Guests will experience a unique, clean, quiet, and welcoming area in Salem.
transit: Public transportation is not available in my area.
access: Guests have access to the main living area, kitchen, laundry, private bedroom and bathroom, large closet, two decks, and Wifi.
interaction: I will be present to meet guests upon arrival and assist them in getting settled and oriented to the home.  I do work full time but usually home in the evenings and weekend.
host_about:
I have lived in my home in South Salem for 30 years.  It is a great place, very comfortable -- and easy to maintain.
I grew up in Eugene, Oregon but graduated from Oregon State in Corvallis. I was a high school teacher for 12 years.  Part of my teaching years were in Australia.  Very fond memories of living and traveling in Australia.  (My son was born in Australia.)
I work full time for Polk County in Dallas, Oregon.  I am a case manager for individuals with intellectual/development disabilities and I also license all of the adult foster homes in Polk County.
I enjoy skiing, working in my yard, going to movies, going to concerts, and spending time with my family.  I am also an avid NASCAR fan and football fan (college and professional.)
Hosting individuals in my home has been a rewarding experience.  I enjoy entertaining, meeting new and interesting people.  I want individuals staying at my home to have a restful, enjoyable, and comfortable experience.
Life motto;  Work hard, have fun, and be nice.

name: Century House Doug Fir Room
summary: Century House is just a few blocks from downtown, Bush Park, the Capitol, Willamette University, and Amtrak. Double bed, brand new private bathroom, kitchenette, two sitting rooms, with fireplace or wood stove.  Hi-speed internet.  Park-like back yard with fire pit. Bicycles (plus gear, maps) for rent.   Anytime coffee/tea/treats. Complimentary homemade morning pastry or fruit parfait.  Full-course breakfast available for $12.50/person.
space: Location, location, location.  Century House is just that.  Built in 1912, it has been through flood and earthquake, but has been lovingly renovated to reflect the New England heritage of your hostess, Jean.  Filled with modern amenities, and many non-fiction adventure books, games, a century-old baby grand piano.  No TV, and no apologies :-).

Filled with modern amenities, and many non-fiction adventure books, games, a century-old baby grand piano.  No TV, and no apologies :-). I am home a lot, except when I'm bicycling, but I don't si
neighborhood_overview: Walking/bicycling access to everything!
notes: Let's go for a bike ride!  Bicycles available at a minimal fee for guest use.
transit: Transit buses Monday through Friday, but like I said, walk to everything.
access: Coffee, tea, the cookie jar, the shady back yard, the common room, an extra sitting room, kitchenette, off-street parking, carriage house bicycle parking.
interaction: I am home a lot, except when I'm bicycling, but I don't sit around much :-).  I enjoy having morning coffee and chatting with guests.
house_rules: I want guests to be comfy! I am very frugal (except when it comes to guest amenities), and I hope guests are responsible to turn off heaters, appliances, lights, etc., when not in use. No smoking.
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: CAPITOL CITY RETREAT
summary: Our home is a quiet retreat "away from home" in a pleasant South Salem neighborhood within 5 minutes of I-5. The QUEEN ROOM upstairs has a queen bed and an en suite full bath.
space: The bath in the Queen Room is en suite, i.e. "in bedroom"!
description: Our home is a quiet retreat "away from home" in a pleasant South Salem neighborhood within 5 minutes of I-5. The QUEEN ROOM upstairs has a queen bed and an en suite full bath. The bath in the Queen Room is en suite, i.e. "in bedroom"! The patio and kitchen are the common areas accessible to the guests. However, the kitchen is not available to guests after 8pm to allow hosts to relax and unwind after making their guests comfortable. :) There is a small refrigerator available for guests and cupboard space can be arranged.  Guests may schedule cooking time for full use of kitchen but otherwise it’s restricted to simple prep. Laundry should be completed by 8 pm. We will be glad to provide any information our guests need and if we don't have answers we will find out. We enjoy getting acquainted with people and like to visit but if our guests want to be left to themselves after the initial introductions we will honor this wish. We live in a quiet, safe, inviting neighborhood with good sidewa
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet, safe, inviting neighborhood with good sidewalks lined with rhododendrons, black berries and various trees and shrubs. We live within minutes of the freeway, I-5, and a full service gym, THE COURTHOUSE, which is within a 10 minute walk from our residence. The city of Salem and several parks are reachable within a few minutes and easy to get to. We have a variety of cafes and restaurants we will be glad to direct you to.
notes: We would love to cook for our guests and if they should opt for a "stay at home" meal in the evening or would like us to pack a lunch we will be glad to do so for a reasonable, additional fee! A continental breakfast only is included with the stay.
transit: We have a public transit bus stop a 3 minute or less walk from our front door. And, of course, taxis and rental cars are available and we can help you with this information. Uber is now active in the Salem area as well.
access: The patio and kitchen are the common areas accessible to the guests. However, the kitchen is not available to guests after 8pm to allow hosts to relax and unwind after making their guests comfortable. :) There is a small refrigerator available for guests and cupboard space can be arranged.  Guests may schedule cooking time for full use of kitchen but otherwise it’s restricted to simple prep. Laundry should be completed by 8 pm.
interaction: We will be glad to provide any information our guests need and if we don't have answers we will find out. We enjoy getting acquainted with people and like to visit but if our guests want to be left to themselves after the initial introductions we will honor this wish.
house_rules: We will expect anyone staying with us to respect our home as we will respect our guests sharing our home temporarily. We do not offer tv/living room access unless invited. It is our area in which to relax. We do not allow smoking and we don't allow pets. We ask that noise levels be minimal after 10:00 pm. If using the laundry facilities please insure that you have completed the process by 10:00 pm. We also would ask that if your schedule makes it necessary to shower late please keep in mind that others in the household may be sleeping. Please leave shoes just inside the entry door. Thank you!
host_about:
We sold our ranch on the Red River in N.E. Texas in 2013 and headed north to the Portland, Oregon area where 2 of our children were living. We became enamored with the smaller city of Salem, Oregon and chose it as our next home allowing us to be closer to our two children and my parents. 
My husband, Earl, and I both love to cook and I enjoy baking. I just recently began participating in the Salem Saturday Market season running April through October. It keeps me extremely busy but there are always yummy treats for our guests. Earl is a coffee perfectionist and our guests always get a fresh ground, fresh aero press cup of coffee as early as they need it.
Before moving to Texas in 1990 we lived in Homer, Alaska on the Kenai Peninsula for 20 years. Earl worked on the North Slope at Prudhoe Bay and was on the original crew that sent the first oil down the Alaska pipeline in 1978. Earl had always wanted to farm so off we went to Texas to raise beef cattle, soybeans and wheat. 
We love to travel and within the past year we made three road trips to Salem from NE Texas taking a different route each time. Earl enjoys sports and is an Aggie who also is a Dallas Cowboys fan. I enjoy a good read whenever time allows and a good movie is always appreciated.
We love hosting and having the opportunity to meet so many different personalities and learn about different parts of our world and how we all fit together in it. We have the same attitude toward staying as guests. Airbnb is the perfect ambassador for our world.
We are now into our new adventure and we invite you to be a part of it!

name: Chauffeurs Room @ the Villa
summary: FEBRUARY SAVINGS ~ STAY 3 nights and save 20%. Our 1924 Villa is a Historic home in quaint Fairmount Hills Neighborhood. This loft is great for business travelers, couples, and solo adventurers. With a private entrance, you can enjoy a quiet, secluded stay.  Our historic neighborhood is a safe place to walk and explore. We are close to Downtown, Bush Park, Salem Hospital, Willamette University,  and Convention Center. We are also a great home base  for exploring wineries and other communities.
space: The studio is a quiet, private retreat above the garage, with all the necessities for a comfortable stay. The kitchen is equipped with fridge, microwave, hotplate, toaster and electric kettle.  We will get you started with homemade granola and sometimes a baked treat.  Complimentary tea and coffee are provided along with a long list of restaurant recommendations.  The queen size, pillow top mattress is made up with luxury linens.  Guests are welcome to use the back patio and feel free to stroll through the garden. This is a non-smoking environment, inside and out. For safety reasons and respect to all guests we do not allow smoking, burning candles or incense in the suite. No guests allowed in the suite that have not been verified through Airbnb or are not included in the reservations. Sorry, no pets allowed.  Please conserve energy. We want to be as low-impact as possible, so please conserve energy by turning off the lights and heat when you go out. Please make sure the doors and wind

neighborhood_overview: Safe, quiet community, historic neighborhood. The studio is a few blocks from the Salem Art Fair, a short walk to eateries, museums, library, parks, Salem Hospital, Willamette University and the Capitol. This is wine country and we will be happy to share our favorites for you to visit.
notes: As your hosts we wish to make your stay comfortable. Breakfast items will be available. If you have special dietary needs please let us know.
transit: On street parking is available. It’s best to park on our side of Lincoln and walk to up curved drive.
access: Guests are welcome to use the back patio and feel free to stroll through the garden.
interaction: We love having friends here, old and new, and will happily interact according to your interest. If you prefer privacy we will be happy to let you do your own thing. Whatever your reason for visiting Salem, we will do what we can to help you be comfortable and have a great time. We will be present during your stay or reachable by phone if we are temporarily away from the house.
house_rules: Check-in 4:00 PM Respect for neighbors. No Pets, No Tobacco. Have fun and enjoy your stay. Leave it how you would hope to find it the next time you stay. Check-out 11:00 AM
host_about: We are an active couple that loves our home, neighborhood and surrounding area. We love the solitude of hiking and the warmth of an evening surrounded by family and friends.

name: Downtown Salem Loft in Salem Oregon
summary: New York style loft located in Salem's oldest historic building in downtown Salem, Oregon.  2400 Sq. Ft. Exquisite furnishings. Gourmet Kitchen. Quiet Venue.PLEASE ADULTS ONLY. Same owner 30 years.
space: I am offering my 2400 Sq. Ft. second floor historic loft. $20,000 in recent exquisite furnishings. Master bedroom with king size bed. Second bedroom with queen size wall bed. Well appointed gourmet kitchen. On-street parking and entrance.  There is also a designated off-street free parking space available for my Loft guest.  We cater to tourists, friends, and families who value experiencing historic properties in urban settings. Feel free to tour our Oregon State Capitol, historic state archives, historic downtown Salem shopping district, and theaters, gardens and museums. We also cater to visiting parents and family members of students and others attending or affiliated with Willamette University or Law School, legislators, Salem Convention Center attendees and those coming to enjoy our Mid-Willamette wine country and anyone else who wants to experience historical beauty. My historic loft is located on Commercial St between Chemeketa and Court St in the heart of historic downtown Sale

neighborhood_overview: This loft is located 4 city blocks from the Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University and Halle Ford Museum. 2 blocks from the Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and the Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants.  Full service mall, Salem Center, offers 65 National and local brands stores.  There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.  Parks Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres park that is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths.  A $10 Million foot bridge is currently under construction and will open access to 800 acres of paved walking,
notes: You must be able to safely navigate up and down the stairs (see photos). There is no elevator. No pets are allowed in the loft.
transit: Cherriots Transit Center is 3 blocks away and all the bus routes are available here: (URL HIDDEN)
access: The entire property is available except an owner's cleaning closet in the back room.
interaction: I will be happily available to help with any questions or concerns both before and during your stay! Don't hesitate to contact me, I want you to have the best and most relaxing time possible while your stay at my beautiful Loft!
house_rules: The living space is elegant with expensive furnishing and art.  The fir floors are 147 years old so we ask that you remove your shoes and use the available cozy and thick foot warmers when in the loft, or just wear your socks or go barefoot. Floors are spotlessly clean.  This space is not a place for children, there is nothing for children to do in the loft. No pets allowed.
host_about:
My name is Angela Jones, I grew up and have lived in Salem for the majority of my life. It is my home and I am so excited to share it with visitors! I have twin boys Max and Sam, who I am currently using my vacation rentals to help put them both through college! My boys are my world! I am also an Arbonne Independent Consultant. Arbonne provides pure, safe and beneficial health and beauty products. Our products are made for those that don't want to use harsh chemicals and want true results in their health and their looks! 

I decided to start my vacation rental with my Downtown Salem Loft when I got close to having to start pay for my boys college. I now also co-host the Jefferson Garden Cottage in Salem OR as well, and soon I will have a third vacation rental up and running also in Downtown Salem! I love the hospitality business and supplying guests with beautiful, comfortable, and usable spaces to stay in for a much more reasonable price than staying in a hotel. 

I love to get to know all my guests and to make new connections. I hope you stay with me if you ever come to Salem OR!

name: Single room in Comfort Home
summary: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines.  I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met.  This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone.  I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request.
space: Two rental rooms share a very large full bathroom with both tub and shower.  One room has a private half bathroom.  Guests share the grand room with living, dining and kitchen surrounding a three-sided gas fireplace.  Guest can use home gym, backyard with hot tub and barbecue.  The kitchen is designed for cooking and will share small amounts of condiments, spices and other items used for cooking.  My space is on opposite side of house, upstairs and private.   Self check-in is possible but I prefer to meet my guests to orient them to the home. Home has had a recent safety inspection and the only security webcam is upstairs in the owner's private section of the house.  Neighborhood is very safe, but do recommend you lock your car at night.  Good neighborhood watch that assures overall safety in this neighborhood.
description: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. The kitchen is designed for cooking and will share small amounts of condiments, spices and other items used for cooking.  My space is on opposite side of house, upstairs and private.   Self check-in is possible but I prefer to meet
neighborhood_overview: Well established high end neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Located on a cul-de-sac with adequate parking and little traffic so it is very quiet.  Feels like a mountain resort due to the large and dense oak and pine trees.  Back yard opens into quiet and beautiful neighborhood park.   10 minutes from I-5 Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from my home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery.  4 miles from downtown Salem.  Blocks from gas station.
notes: Available for orienting you to my home and helping you find the local resources you need.  Interested in interacting in common space when conducive to both of us.  Appreciate texting and good communication to meet your needs.
transit: Both Uber and Lift now operate in Salem.  Walking distance to Transit bus system.  4 miles to downtown for restaurants, shopping, Riverfront, Hospital and Capitol. Hiking trail within walking distance.  Hybrid bike available for guest use.
access: Full hall bath only for renters.  Grand room with three sided gas fireplace. Full kitchen.
interaction: Available for orienting you to my home and helping you find the local resources you need.  Interested in interacting in common space when conducive to both of us.  Appreciate texting and good communication to meet your needs.
host_about: I have lived in this home 21 years and have truly made it comfortable to both me and my guests.  The house is perfectly designed to accommodate guests as we built the 2-story extension that I live in upstairs which provides privacy for both myself and my guests.  My guests and I commonly share the downstairs which includes the kitchen, dining and living room, gym and back yard where there is a hot tub.

name: Charming Craftsman...Close to Downtown!
summary: Salem's best breakfast place (WoM), the state capitol, Willamette University, Salem Hospital and downtown are all close by! The inside of this nearly one hundred year old Craftsman house has a comfortable charm with a mix of old and new style. Three bedrooms plus dining and family room give guests plenty of space to move about. Plus, there is a huge backyard for pets and a fire pit to enjoy. We love it and think you will too! We are registered with the City of Salem: License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) LI.
space: This is a 1925 Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sunporch and a patio outside with a firepit (and PLENTY of wood!) If you would like to see specifics on two of the bedrooms, check out "Cozy Room in Central Salem" and "Inspiring Room in Central Salem" as we rent the rooms out on nights that the whole house is not rented. Please note two of the beds are full size futon beds. They are the two rooms we rent out individually and have very high ratings. The master rooms has a queen bed and the daybed is a twin mattress.

neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbors. While most people are indoors during the rainy Oregon winters, if you get a chance to talk to them, they are such lovely people and friends of ours. There are two churches on the street, convenience stores in very short walking distance, and nice sidewalks all along for strolls.
notes: We were not able to set up the pool this year due to a large hole that is currently not able to be fixed.
transit: Public buses are close by. It is a 5-8 minute walk to markets and Word of Mouth, 20 minute walk to the grocery store, and 25 minutes to downtown. Bicycles and kayaks available for use with advanced notice. Uber and Lyft are now offered in the Salem area. Amtrak/Greyhound station is a 10 minute walk.
access: You have the entire upstairs of the house. You will have access to all three bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen, living room, dining room and . There is an apartment in the basement that is not included in rental, as the space is used by our co-host as needed. Laundry accessibility is in the basement.
interaction: We are always available via text, call, or Airbnb site. My husband and I may be around the area to welcome you or we will ensure you have all necessary information to enter the house. Either of us are available for any questions before or during your stay.
house_rules: We love this house and we hope you will love it too. It is truly a "home" in every sense of the word. Please respect the space as you would your own home. Not suitable for those expecting a "hotel-like" experience.
host_about: We enjoy traveling to different countries, mostly to know the people who live there. It just so happened that Christy traveled to Europe in 2015 and met Arnaud in Belgium. We rent our house to commuters and friends so we're very used to shared spaces/renting private rooms. When we travel, we rent out the entire house. Music and learning and relationships are other passions in life. Mix all that in with some good scenery, interesting food, and drinks and we're in heaven.

name: Private Room In Quiet West Salem Neighborhood
summary: Private bedroom with Queen Bed and private detached bathroom. Located on quiet street with no through traffic 2 miles from downtown Salem. Room includes a 40" HDTV with antenna TV including channels from Fox, CBS, ABC, Plus Netflix and Amazon prime video. Large closet with some basic clothes hangers, one chair and side table.  There is a mini fridge upstairs for guests and a Keurig cup coffee maker, coffee, sweeteners, non dairy creamer. Three windows provide fresh air and natural light.
space: Bedroom and bathroom are on the top floor of the residence.  Bedroom amenities include newer queen size bed, 3 drawer dresser, 40" HDTV, 2 nights stands, chair,foot rest and side table.  High speed wifi internet access will be provided with stay.  TV includes 20 plus local channels including Fox, CBS, ABC.  In addition, TV has access to netflix & amazon instant video library with thousands of free titles.  The large closet has clothes hangers available for use.  Room has 3 opening windows for fresh air and windows are covered with room darkening curtains.  Private bathroom next to bedroom with large counter space, one sink and shower over tub.  The bathroom is equipped with  bath towels, hand towels,  wash clothes, hand soap, toilet paper and a blow dryer.  Washer and dryer is available on same floor as bedroom for guest who may need to do a load of laundry.

neighborhood_overview: Located approximately 2 Miles from downtown shopping, dining and the Capital building. Several tripadvisor rated parks are within 5-10 minutes such as the Salem Riverfront Park , Minto-Brown Island State Park, and Bush Pasture Park.  Located about an hour from Oregon's coast, 1 hour to Portland,  40 minutes from Spirit Mountain Casino, 30 minutes to the Woodburn premium outlets, 2 hours to Mt. Hood State Park, 40 minutes to Silver Creek Falls. About 10 minutes from Willamette University, 15 minutes from Chemeketa Community College and 20 minutes from Western Oregon University.  There are also many wineries within 15 -30 minutes depending on which way you're headed.  Minutes from Starbucks and Dutch Brothers Coffee.
notes: The room  is on the top floor of the townhouse and requires going up two flights of stairs to reach the room.  Guest may park a vehicle on right side of the driveway.  There is no street parking allowed on the drive. Due to severe allergies we cannot accommodate service animals.
transit: We are located in West Salem across the Willamette River and on weekdays during commute hours there is traffic going into Salem, in the morning and returning to West Salem in the evening, but at other hours of the day there is little to no traffic. If you plan on visiting Salem without a vehicle, we are located approximately 20 minute walk from Glen Creek Rd Cherriots Bus Transfer Center.  If you plan on using bus service and would like a closer bus station, you can schedule a pickup 5 minutes away via the West Salem Connector.  The West Salem Connector runs from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. Riders book trips at (URL HIDDEN) or by cal(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).   It's best to book in advance according to their website. 10 Minutes from Greyhound, Enterprise rent a car and Amtrak station.  In addition, guests can use Uber or Lyft to get around town.
access: Private guest bedroom and bathroom. Please be mindful that we don't offer the use of the kitchen as a part of our listing. I do supply some water bottles and a mini fridge upstairs for guest use.  We don't share the living room as we run a small home business and will often be working in that space taking photos, etc.
interaction: I will be in and out of the home, you can always message me if you have any questions or trouble accessing the home.
house_rules: Please read the listing details and rules before booking your stay.  Please no smoking and no pets.  There is no street parking allowed on the drive so guest may park in the driveway on the right side.  No parties or extra guests beyond those included in your reservation are allowed in the room. We do not offer access to the living room as we run a small home business and will often be working in that space. Kitchen access is not included for our listing.  The washer and dryer are available for guest use but are not to be used past 9PM.  Otherwise please feel free to enjoy your stay.
host_about: Love to travel and see new places.

name: WittsPad
summary: The Edgewater District is the history of West Salem.  Conveniently located on the edge of downtown Salem, you are within walking/biking distance from local eateries, the river, Audubon, coffee shop, tap-house, bookstore, mini-free libraries & more!
space: There are 2 rooms available in this historical 1920's Craftsman.  Beginning at the top, the attic offers a cozy studio-like atmosphere with a bookcase dividing the bedroom area from the private living room.  The sofa in the living room pulls out to sleep 2 more guests, quite comfortably, on a memory foam mattress topper.  The room is equipped with it's own portable air-conditioner/heating unit (and remote) for your preferred comfort.  See photos of this listing by searching "WittsPad - Attic", or, find it under our listing profile. The bedroom on the main floor sleeps 2 and boasts plenty of natural light.  This room is adjacent to the shared bathroom and the common-area living room.  Doors have a latch lock from the inside.  There is a digital window fan, with remote, in place during the warmer months.

neighborhood_overview: We are so close to a variety of options for recreation and enjoyment. If you enjoy reading, there are several mini-free libraries in our immediate neighborhood & throughout Salem.  We have a stash of books available for you to use as your "swap" with any of the inventory in the mini's.  Or, if you want to get lost in our local new/used bookstore, "Reader's Guide", it's only blocks away :) Also just 3 blocks away is a small but lovely Audobon Reserve where you can birdwatch, or, just stroll through and enjoy the nature trails. Enjoy biking?  Bring your own distance bike, or, use one of our "everyday" bikes to explore the nearby Willamette Valley Scenic Bikeway. Walking/Running opportunities are just outside the door, when you jump on the greenway of Edgewater Park and head toward Riverfront Park, Wallace Marine Park, or, Minto Island Brown Park.  There is a lovely walking bridge nearby to cross the Willamette River by foot or bike. And let's not forget that we are in wine country, here!
notes: This listing is for the bedroom on the main floor, which sleeps 2.  If you are interested in the attic, which sleeps a max of 4, please adjust the filters of your search to "4 people" and book accordingly.  Feel free to contact me with any questions prior to booking.
transit: Public bus stop is one block away.  Amtrak is less than 3 miles away.  We have bikes available, for your enjoyment while staying with us.
access: The main floor of our Craftsman is the heart of the home, and we invite you to make yourself comfortable.  Here you will find the kitchen, living-room, dining room & library.  Just off of the library is the shared bathroom and the stairs leading up to the attic room. This floor is also where you access the outdoor areas, like the back porch, backyard, or bicycles for cruising the city.  The basement is where laundry is done, if needed.
interaction: Whether you are here on business or pleasure, we will follow your lead on how much, or little, interaction you desire. We are definitely happy to support you with recommendations or answer any questions...just ask :) Breakfast on weekdays is a continental offering of quick bites (breads/pastries, fruit, etc.) During the weekends, you are invited to gather with us at the dining table to enjoy a hot meal together. Coffee Bar set up daily by 7:07am and includes creamer, sugar & Torani syrups.  Loose leaf tea is also available.  Coffee beans roasted fresh and delivered weekly by local coffee roaster, Steel Bridge Coffee.  It's delightful! We do have pets, an 11 year old Golden Lab, a 1 year old Akbash, and a 4 year old cat; all are indoor/outdoor pets.  Their entertaining antics are included with your fee ;)
house_rules: 10pm quiet time :)

name: Spacious Suite with Private Sauna and AC
summary: Beautiful, large private Suite, w/ own key entry.  Sparkling clean, upscale comfortable, you'll feel pampered right away.  Bedroom with en-suite and private sauna, living room, kitchenette.  Clutter-free space with garden, patio and BBQ.  Convenient West Salem location, close to downtown and Willamette U., Salem Hospital and many wineries. Walk to shops and beautiful parks.   Fully licensed and compliant with City of Salem codes. Book by the week and save 20%!
space: An actual guest review: "Fantastic place to stay. Beautiful part of Salem and the house was nicer than advertised. You can't go wrong." Enjoy privacy in a beautiful and comfortable space with large master bedroom, private large living room including big screen TV and "kitchenette," which  includes a microwave, mini-fridge, Keurig coffee machine and bar sink (there is no stove.)  There is also a new Infrared CharBroil BBQ on the patio for your use. Your own exterior key entrance allows for flexibility in your schedule.  At more than 770 sq. ft., the Suite is larger than some homes. Fabulous queen bed with silky linens in the master bedroom.  The sparkling clean and comfortable space will give you a sense of pleasant welcome right away.   The large living room has a full size sofa sleeper (with a new memory foam mattress!) in addition to the leather sofa recliner.  The bedroom en-suite also has a private sauna.  How many properties offer your own private sauna, this one does!  The scenic

Bedroom with en-suite and private sauna, living room, kitchenette.  Clutter-free space with garden, patio and BBQ.  Convenient West Salem location, close to downtown and Willamette U., Salem Hospital and many wineries. Walk to shops and beautiful parks.   Fully licensed and compliant with City of Salem codes. Book by the week and save 20%! An actual guest review: "Fantastic place to stay. Beautiful part of Salem and the house was nicer than advertised. You can't go wrong." There is also a new Infrared CharBroil BBQ on the patio for your use. Your own exterior key entrance allows for flexibility in your schedule.  At more th
neighborhood_overview: Explore wineries, waterfalls and the spectacular Oregon coast from your lovely and quiet West Salem location.  The Suite is within walking distance of shops and restaurants.  Only 2 miles to Capitol, Willamette University and downtown area.  Lots of trees and parks in neighborhood.  Beautiful hiking opportunities abound including "Silver Falls" which boasts 10 glorious waterfalls and miles of hiking trails.  Willamette Valley wineries including "Wine Spectator" top 100 picks will delight you.  Dozens of fabulous wineries in Salem and even more a short drive away.  The beach is only 45 minutes away.  One hour from Portland and airport.
notes: NO SMOKING OF ANY KIND, NO INCENSE, NO CANDLES Private, off-street parking available for one vehicle in designated space.  HOUSEKEEPING:  While fresh linens and bath towels are included in The Suite, daily housekeeping is not. As AirBnB is a community,  most hosts expect that at the end of your stay you take the sheets off the bed and place in the laundry basket (located in closet), along with towels.  We truly appreciate it! Wash all dishes and put them away.  Generally tidy up. We will empty all garbage bins. *** House is privately owned. Owner is not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on premises. Homeowners are not responsible for the loss of personal belongings or valuables of the guests.
transit: Off-street designated parking for one vehicle only.  Public transportation within easy walking distance.
access: Private key entrance.  The Suite, including living room, sauna, kitchenette are all your private space.  This space is not shared with anyone else.  The paver patio is right outside your door, with a  BBQ and lovely garden.
interaction: Hosts on-site and available by text or phone call.  We love to meet our guests but we will also respect your privacy.
house_rules: *  Use of the sauna is at your own risk.  Please follow the posted safety       instructions. *  No smoking on or near  property, no drugs, no pets.   *  Only registered guests on premises. *  Respect for neighbors.   *  One vehicle only, and must be in the reserved parking spot.   *  No loud noise during sleeping hours of 10:00 pm to 8:00 am.   We charge only a nominal cleaning fee in the belief that people will respect a nice property and leave it as they found it.   and..."The Golden Rule."
host_about:
We love the Pacific Northwest!  Beautiful trees, parks, wineries and cultural activities abound.  Our new retreat/apartment will amaze you.  It's 770 sq ft. of gorgeous, quiet space and is an incredible value.  House hunting?  Visiting faculty?  This is the perfect home for you.

We are former long-term residents of Santa Cruz, California and never thought we could love anyplace as much--but we found out we love Salem and the Pacific Northwest even more!  We are voracious readers, faith and family are very important to us and we love to cook, entertain and visit wineries.  

We have a very large house because we have 5 grown children who we hope will visit--but our kids have very busy lives all over the country--In the meantime, we'd love to share our home with you.

name: Stylish, Private, Urban Guest House
summary: Enjoy our renovated, private guest house close to downtown Salem. We are on the city bicycle route in a historic, tree-lined neighborhood. Relaxing outdoor space and fully fenced yard. Note: The City of Salem requires a 9% Occupancy Tax, which is included in our nightly rate.
space: The guest house is renovated with reclaimed wood used throughout. There is a small kitchenette with a sink, mini-fridge and small microwave. We encourage guests to visit the local eateries and not to "cook" in the space. However, you can heat leftovers or items in the microwave. We do not provide pots, pans and cooking items for this reason. There is air conditioning (and heat, of course), and an additional heater in the bathroom. There is an outdoor space for lounging when the weather is nice and a portico entry if it is raining, so you can remove wet gear. The yard is fully fenced and secure if you bring your pet. We also provide locally crafted items such as soaps and coffee.

We also provide locally crafted items such as soaps and coffee. Guests are welcome to use the yard
neighborhood_overview: We are on the city bicycle route in a historic, tree-lined neighborhood. Walk to the Salem Farmer’s Market, Broadway Coffee House, McMenamins Boon's Treasury, and more. We are also a mile from downtown and a short drive to Willamette University.
notes: It rains here (a lot) in the winter months, so please be prepared for wet weather. We live in a city neighborhood, so please take valuables with you (do not leave them in your car). Parking is on-street and we appreciate your being respectful of our wonderful neighbors. Please park in front of our house! Keep language and behavior clean and conversation at a respectful level at all times. We recycle! Please use the recycle bin for cans, bottles, paper, and so forth. Also, we have a guest house-sized water heater, so keep this in mind if you are used to taking long showers. A manual with further instructions/tips is in the guest house.
transit: We are about one (1) mile from the Capital Building. So, it is a very short drive or pleasant walk. Broadway (two blocks to the west) is on the city bus route.
access: Guests are welcome to use the yard for their pets and enjoying the outdoors. Note: The yard is a shared space with the hosts and our dog. The guest house is a private space (with private bathroom), so you will have all you need to enjoy your stay.
interaction: We will likely be here in the main house to accommodate your needs, but we are also available via cell/text/email.
house_rules: - If you smoke or partake, please do so outside where we have provided a receptacle.  - Pet Policy: Sorry! No cats, please. Only socialized dogs allowed as yard space is shared with us and our dog. We are dog lover’s and as such we appreciate that your dog will be in an unfamiliar place during their stay. We will do all we can to assure their safety and comfort. It is City of Salem law that your pet cannot be unattended in a yard (and barking) for more than ten minutes. Therefore, we do not allow you to leave your pet in the yard unattended. In addition, we are strongly opposed to leaving your pet unattended for long periods in the guest house. We require pet owner’s to provide us with a contact number in case your pet is uncomfortable and needs attention. Please be aware that we are highly sensitive to your pets needs and will not hesitate to put their needs first in all matters. We will provide “poo” bags so you are able to clean up after your pet. Thank you and we look forward to me
host_about: Robert and I are avid campers and enjoy living in the Pacific Northwest. Although we love to travel, it is hard to leave the area as there are so many beautiful places to enjoy. We have a grown son and are dog lovers, love coffee, books, and always a great conversation around a camp fire. I am also a Realtor in Salem, so if you have any questions or needs, just let me know how I can help!

name: Spacious home near downtown Salem
summary: This charming 1927 home has been completely remodeled.  The Willamette  River runs behind the homes across the street and the centrally located house is a one mile walk or bus ride to downtown.
space: This is a lovely older home that has been completely remodeled.  It is  surrounded by big leaf maple trees and the Willamette River runs behind the houses across the street.  There is a bedroom with a full sized bed and a couch that folds out to a queen sized bed.
description: This charming (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) home has been completely remodeled.  The Willamette  River runs behind the homes across the street and the centrally located house is a one mile walk or bus ride to downtown. This is a lovely older home that has been completely remodeled.  It is  surrounded by big leaf maple trees and the Willamette River runs behind the houses across the street.  There is a bedroom with a full sized bed and a couch that folds out to a queen sized bed. You have access to the entire first floor.  You have a private locked entrance to your apartment. The proximity to the river is a great part of this neighborhood as are the large trees.  Riverfront
neighborhood_overview: The proximity to the river is a great part of this neighborhood as are the large trees.  Riverfront park and the carousal  and West Salem Park are about a one mile walk from the house as is downtown Salem.  The Broadway district with an Independent theatre, coffee shops, restaurants and a wine bar is a little less than a mile away.  There is a rail line about 4 blocks from the house.  Although it is not a main line, trains do pass through about twice a night and blow their whistle.  Earplugs are provided.
notes: This property is licensed by the City of Salem (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
transit: The house is 2 blocks from the bus stop and there is ample parking in front of the house.
access: You have access to the entire first floor.  You have a private locked entrance to your apartment.  There is a full kitchen and laundry, a living room, dining room and bedroom.
interaction: Generally speaking, I am available during the day.  I live in the upstairs apartment and if I am not home, I am generally available by phone.  Should I be traveling I have a friend who will be available to answer questions and assist you.
house_rules: I trust that you will treat my home with the same respect that you treat your own home.  The obvious rules…no illegal drugs, no guns, no parties, no smoking.  Please observe quiet hours between 10pm and 8 am.
host_about:
I am a retired psychotherapist.  It has been a labor of love to restore this lovely old house.  I love the outdoors and often hike, camp or kayak. I also enjoy meeting new people.  
Traveling is my passion and I have visited many countries and have enjoyed my stays in air b and b's.  Volunteerism is another passion and I hope to volunteer in Central America soon. There is some awesome energy in this house and I believe that more people will bring more good energy.

host_about: My wife and I have lived in the Northwest for over 20 years. We have two beautiful kids. We enjoy the outdoors and traveling to new places. My wife is a Beaver(Oregon State Alum) and I am a Husky(University of Washington Alum). We spend time with friends and family in both Oregon and  Washington. We love to host and tend to have great experiences as guests when we travel. Our goal is to share our space with our guests by offering similar experiences we enjoy during travel.

neighborhood_overview: It's a wonderful and quiet neighborhood with beautiful trees that cover the streets. Given that the house is over 100 years old and has been fully remodeled/restored, it truly is a gem!
notes: We have one roommate that lives in the home. He is very friendly, but very quiet and usually keeps to himself.
transit: The bus line runs right by the Main Street which is one home from mine, making commuting VERY convenient. Also if you are coming from Portland or the airport check out the SMART bus route which is a very easy way to travel.
access: Guests are ok during your stay (except for spending the night unless you've selected the "multiple" guest option when booking my place) we just ask that they be respectful of our property. No shoes inside, no parties and no alcohol/smoking or recreational marijuana on the property whatsoever
interaction: I live in Portland making it difficult to meet every guest that stays at my place. However when I'm there I always try to say hello. I'm easily reachable by message so feel free to contact me with any questions
house_rules: -Enjoy your stay. -Respect the place and other guest.  -Clean up after your stay. -Smoking, alcohol,other drugs or weapons is NOT allowed on the property if this is a problem then maybe this is not a good fit for your stay.  -Due to allergies we don't allow pets.
host_about: I am in my early 30's came from a great Biblical missionary family, I enjoy beautiful  Oregon outdoors and different cultural foods. Currently my family and I live and work in Portland.  I have a great house in Salem that we decided to rent out for long and short term via Airbnb i am gone a lot and most of the time i am not in Salem but at my house in Portland . All 5 bedrooms are furnished with welcoming environment for your enjoyable stay.

About a mile to I5 and six miles to downtown with easy access to highway and main through streets, Commercial and Sunny side. About a mile to I5 and six miles to downtown with easy access to highway and main through streets, Commercial and Sunny side. Laundry, fireplace, parking, private bath and continental breakfast are just some of the perks. I have a cot available for a third person if needed. Tea and essentials provided. Coffee and continental breakfast provided upon request for small fee (I have dietary restrictions so end up throwing so much out otherwise). Once weekly laundry (detergent not provided), fireplace, wifi, private bath, parking, extra cot available if third person in group and so much more! I work a lot, but alwa
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet and backs into a nest of beautiful, swaying fir trees. Across the way is cinnamon lake which brings wildlife such as deer and geese! Safe area with parks and access to running trails.
notes: I absolutely love the idea of bringing strangers together. Creating friendships wether brief or lasting enhances the lives of all encountered on life's perilously divine journey.️
transit: There is a bus stop a hop skip and a jump away!
access: Tea and essentials provided. Coffee and continental breakfast provided upon request for small fee (I have dietary restrictions so end up throwing so much out otherwise). Once weekly laundry (detergent not provided), fireplace, wifi, private bath, parking, extra cot available if third person in group and so much more!
interaction: I work a lot, but always enjoy a good chat or a friendly jaunt around town with my guests. The fun of air bnb is getting to know people and create friendships if only for a short while.
house_rules: I just ask that you are respectful of my space and things and quiet after 10pm. No access to common areas as respect to host after 10pm. Please limit only necessary activities after this time. No washing clothes after 8pm. Two loads per week and $4 per after that. If you are only staying six days or less it's one load per stay. Remember this is a shared environment. No eating or drinking on couch or in living room(I really love that WHITE couch)! No littering, no anything destructive or unpleasant! Please let me know if you plan to have guests visit you while here. General consideration is expected.That is all. Enjoy my home :)
host_about: I am from Alaska, I enjoy running and being outdoors! I am adventurous and love to travel. I am currently looking for my next adventure overseas! I try to be environmentally conscious and encourage guests to be as well :)

name: Urban homestead in town (with a REAL breakfast)!
summary: Are you interested in raising backyard chickens, gardening, composting, making your own pasta/bread/yogurt, etc?  You don't have to live on a farm to do it. Stay with us and see how easy it is!  A quiet, peaceful home just minutes from downtown.  Enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast every morning including HOME-MADE yogurt, assorted  pastries, toast, and fresh fruit.  Depending on the time of year, there may be blueberries, plums, apples, and figs from our yard.
space: Our house is in a quiet, safe neighborhood in west Salem surrounded by beautiful wine country and Christmas tree farms.  It's a short drive over the bridge to downtown Salem, about 60 miles north to Portland, 60 miles south to Eugene, or 50 miles west to the coast.  We are world travelers, especially Europe and enjoy helping other travelers. We love to garden and cook (mostly Italian).
description: Are you interested in raising backyard chickens, gardening, composting, making your own pasta/bread/yogurt, etc?  You don't have to live on a farm to do it. Stay with us and see how easy it is!  A quiet, peaceful home just minutes from downtown.  Enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast every morning including HOME-MADE yogurt, assorted  pastries, toast, and fresh fruit.  Depending on the time of year, there may be blueberries, plums, apples, and figs from our yard. Our house is in a quiet, safe neighborhood in west Salem surrounded by beautiful wine country and Christmas tree farms.  It's a short drive over the bridge to downtown Salem, about 60 miles north to Portland, 60 miles south to Eugene, or 50 miles west to the coast.  We are world travelers, especially Europe and enjoy helping other travelers. We love to garden and cook (mostly Italian). You will have your own room equipped with wi-fi, an empty dresser, a desk, a window that opens, nightstand, queen sized bed, a basket ful
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is west Salem which is its own little community with cafes, grocery stores, gas stations, etc., but it sits on the west side of the Willamette River while the rest of Salem is on the east side of the river.  Just a quick 5-minute drive over the bridge and you are downtown!
notes: This is my only listing and you are my only guest.  This is a hosted site where we are available to help, advise, and feed you! Everyone is welcome in our home!  We don't own a television. Instead we usually watch Netflix on our tablet in bed in the early evening before retiring for the evening.  This leaves the rest of the house available for your exclusive use - but just knock if you need anything.
transit: Salem has a train station with daily service to Portland and Eugene.  There are also municipal buses and taxis available.
access: You will have your own room equipped with wi-fi, an empty dresser, a desk, a window that opens, nightstand, queen sized bed, a basket full of tourist information and a closet with hangers.  You also have a private bathroom with a shower just outside your bedroom door and curtains in the hall for privacy.  If you need to borrow a fan, ironing board, hair dryer, umbrella, ice chest, beach chairs, etc., just ask!
interaction: We love to travel and enjoy helping other travelers. We can assist with information about transportation, events, local wineries, and so forth (or leave you alone to explore on your own). If interested, we can show you how to raise backyard chickens, garden, compost, make your own pasta, etc.  Learn how to create your own little urban homestead by staying with us!  We recycle here, as well as compost, and utilize the chickens for natural pest control and manure for the gardens.
house_rules: Please respect our privacy and our belongings.  And quiet time is after 9 pm.  Thank you!
host_about: My husband and I are professional 50-somethings planning to retire in Italy in a few years. We are world travelers and especially love Europe.  When we retire we hope to open a small B&B in Sicily so hosting on AirBNB now while still in the United States will provide us with good experience.  Other than traveling, we enjoy gardening, cooking, tennis, dancing, and red wine.  We have one dog and 4 pet hens for the fresh eggs they provide.  I led the fight to legalize backyard chickens in Oregon's capitol city in 2008 and currently teach chicken-raising classes.  Learn how to create your own little urban homestead by staying with us. If you/re interested, I can show you how to raise chickens or make your own pasta/bread/yogurt. Just ask!

name: Cozy room in Central Salem
summary: This room is small but perfect for those who love color and light! Room darkening curtains also allow for mornings of sleeping in.  It is located in the back of our home with its' own door to the backyard and is removed from the other bedrooms and living spaces ensuring a quiet retreat. The new bed now makes a stay for two people a possibility but is still best suited for one due to the coziness of the room. We are registered with the City of Salem: License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) LI.
space: This is a 1925 Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sun porch, sitting space on the back yard patio and a secluded lounging area with fire pit (and PLENTY of wood).

It is located in the back of our home with its' own door to the backyard and is removed from the other bedrooms and living spaces ensuring a quiet retreat. The new bed now makes a stay for two people a possibility but is still best suited for one due to the coziness of the room. We are registered with the City of Salem: License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) LI. This is a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sun porch, sitting space on the back yard patio and a secluded lounging area with fire pit (and PLENTY of wood). Your bedroom is in the back of the house off of the kitchen. You will share the upstairs of the
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbors and our neighborhood. Tree-lined streets, sidewalks, and quiet. We love how central it is to most things in Salem. And we love how central Salem is to most things in western Oregon. The neighborhood and Salem is overall very safe but cars have had things disappear when people forget to lock!
notes: A newly installed furnace and AC keeps the house enjoyable all year round. To cater for individual needs, both fans and space heaters are available. We have a new puppy as of January 2019. He is very chill and we look forward to training him amidst our family of Airbnb guests! Please socialize with him if you get the chance and have the desire. He is a future therapy dog so the more interaction the better.
transit: Both Lyft and Uber are available. Public buses are close by. The Amtrak Station/Greyhound Station is within a 10 minute walk. It is a 5-8 minute walk to convenience stores and the famous breakfast restaurant Word of Mouth, 20 minute walk to the grocery store, and 25 minutes to downtown. The state capital is about 15 minutes away and Willamette University takes only 10 minutes on foot. Bicycles and kayaks available for use with advanced notice.
access: Your bedroom is in the back of the house off of the kitchen. You will share the upstairs of the house with up to two other guests. The owners might be hanging around upstairs for cooking and socialization. The kitchen is fully available for use. Arnaud is quite the culinary adventurer and loves to share his kitchen. The shared bathroom comes with an old style crowfoot bathtub and shower.  Our house has multiple spaces, offering a choice to either be by yourselves (backyard, side yard, front porch) or to interact with hosts and guests. We have hosted many Couchsurfers through the years and love to talk about travel. Laundry utilities are available in the basement for those in need of it.
interaction: We are always available via phone, text, or Airbnb site. When possible, we try to make sure to be home to welcome guests to the home.
house_rules: We love this house and we hope you will love it too. It is truly a "home" in every sense of the word. Please respect the space as you would your own home.
host_about: We enjoy traveling to different countries, mostly to know the people who live there. It just so happened that Christy traveled to Europe in 2015 and met Arnaud in Belgium. We rent our house to commuters and friends so we're very used to shared spaces/renting private rooms. When we travel, we rent out the entire house. Music and learning and relationships are other passions in life. Mix all that in with some good scenery, interesting food, and drinks and we're in heaven.

name: Charming Cottage in Downtown Salem
summary: This charming cottage has it all for longer term stays in Salem.  We are within walking distance of downtown Salem, major hospitals, the State Capital and Willamette University. The best of Salem is a walk away and this cottage is fabulous!
space: This cottage has charm, function and comfort.  The cottage has a kitchen with a full-size electric range and refrigerator, and a laundry room with full-size washer and dryer.   The living room has a lovely gas fireplace, love seat and comfortable reading chair. The colors are warm and vibrant.  The bedrooms are small, so one room has a comfortable queen bed, and the other acts as your dressing room.  The dressing room has a large closet, dresser, chair, mirror and is well lit.   The bathroom has a tub/shower and sink with plenty of storage.  The cottage has a tree and flower lined yard and you will love the sunny courtyard setting.  The Cottage is home away from home at it's best.

The Cottage is home away from home at it's best. The entire cottage is at your disposal. We live nearby, so your needs
neighborhood_overview: There is so much to say about the Neighborhood!!  Here are a few highlights: Places to Eat: Word of Mouth Neighborhood Bistro:  A breakfast must!  Wild Pear: Perfect for lunch or an early dinner. Amadeus:  This is our favorite place for dinner in downtown Salem.  Great food and upscale atmosphere Table 508: A nice dinner destination Bibim Bap House: Causal Asian meal Christos Pizzeria: Great pizza and Italian food Fun Things to do Nearby: Oregon State Capital: Tours are available weekdays from 8 to 4 in the summer Willamette University: Beautiful campus very near the capital so you can do both in the same trip River Park:  Along the banks of the Willamette, this park offers live music and other fun events year round.  It is also a nice destination for a walk. Farmers Market:  Two block up Summer street is an awesome farmers market that runs weekends April thru October. Yum The Oregon Garden: Open 9 to 6 May to Sept check the web site for off season times and events Elsinore Theater:  W
notes: There is a grocery store within walking distance, and many of our guests leave their cars parked their entire stay.  We have a BBQ you can borrow as well.  You will park on the street and we will provide the necessary parking permit.
access: The entire cottage is at your disposal.
interaction: We live nearby, so your needs will be met almost instantaneously!  You will have our cell phone numbers and we will be happy to help!
house_rules: We provide towels and linens, but not cleaning services.  There are always extra sets of sheets and towels, so you can wash and change them as often as you wish.  We provide "starter" quantities of paper towels, toilet paper, laundry detergent, cleaners etc.  Once these are gone, you are on your own.  There is a vacuum, broom, and cleaning rags.  We ask that you use these and not the bath towels for cleaning.  We do not allow pets or smoking (tobacco or Pot).  The cottage feels like it could hold a lot of people, but we are renting it for one or two.  Please do not have additional guests spend the night without permission.
host_about: Recently retired couple who moved to Oregon in 2015.  We enjoy hiking, camping, skiing and seeing all the wonderful things Oregon and the Northwest has to offer.  We like meeting all the new people who have rented our cottage and do our best to make their stays very relaxing and enjoyable

summary: Bungalow behind the main house in West Salem with off street parking. Private courtyard patio, with gas BBQ. Bungalow has 2 bedrooms, 1 1/2 bath,  beautiful kitchen with all amenities, full laundry facilities.  Open living area, very comfortable and welcoming. The bedrooms, living room and dinning area have ceiling fans.  The kitchen is modern with stove, oven, microwave, refrigerator, toaster, blender. All equipment for cooking and or baking.  This bungalow is very opened and just like home.
space: Motorcycle friendly, covered parking available for motorcycles only.  Off street parking you cars.

Hello,
