name: West Hills Modern Luxury- Private Room & Breakfast
summary: 5 minutes away from downtown, 40 minutes from the coast, close to public transportation and parks. A light breakfast of bagels, fruit, coffee and juice will be provided during your stay. You’ll love the place because of the coziness, the kitchen, the high ceilings, the light, and the comfy beds. We do have cats and a parrot. Guests will have the upstairs to themselves and a private bathroom. Shared laundry and kitchen, Keurig/toaster/microwave and fridge space to share.
space: Modern décor with high ceilings and lots of light make the space opening and warm. Plenty of seating in the backyard if you care to enjoy the weather outside from a private location. Hot tub is available with host permission. We have space available in fridge, freezer and cupboards if you want to store food during your stay.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful- mainly a retired community. There is a nice park a short walk uphill that provides a great view of West Salem. Downtown provides some good options for food and shopping- feel free to ask the host for recommendations during your stay.
notes: Cats must not be allowed outside, parrot can make occasional noise. You are welcome to feed the parrot crackers/fruit/veggies (we will have these available), but he does bite so beware of fingers too close to the cage.
transit: Public transportation nearby, downtown Salem is just a 5 minute drive. Easy access to the coast- just 40 minutes down the highway.
access: Guests will have access to the upstairs including bedroom and private bathroom as well as a half bathroom downstairs. Shared space includes the kitchen/dining/family room, laundry and office on the main floor. Backyard patio features a fire pit with chairs, outdoor dining table and hot tub also available. Hot tub requires host permission.
interaction: Space will be shared with host who can be available by phone or in person when needed.
house_rules: - No shoes in house - Quiet hours between 10 and 6 during weekday, 12 and 8 during weekend - Pets aren't allowed outside - Private space must be respected (no access allowed in host's bedroom/bathroom or other areas marked private) - No drug use or other illicit activities - Hot tub use limited to host permission - Permissable to use coffee/keurig, other food and beverage only at host's discretion -Lights and electronics must be turned off when not in use -You are welcome to use dishes, appliances, pans, cooking utensils etc. but we request that you treat these items as if they were your own and clean up after yourself.
host_about: I love to travel. I work as a QC Team Lead for an international company, so I have gotten a number of opportunities to travel around the world. I have many more places on my list to see, but I love to experience new cultures and see new places.  love a good story, so I enjoy various books/movies/games (especially fantasy). I especially love to read (mainly fantasy and science fiction of course), but I don't read nearly as often as I used to (as I'm very busy), but I have finished writing my own novel that I hope to publish one day (and eventually turn into a series!). One mantra I live by- you are only truly limited by yourself (whether beliefs, interests, imagination or otherwise), so I believe in doing the best you can in whatever it is you do (and not letting anyone tell you that something can't be done). Go, achieve and see because the world has unlimited opportunities!

The living, dining and laundry room is all included for your use.
description: Experience a beautiful peaceful room in Salem's quite historic neighborhood. Room is furnished with Queen size bed, over-sized large desk. Great for  business and long stay guests. Closet is equipped with Iron & ironing board extra towels and hangers for your convenience. The room also has an additional full pull-out mattress to accommodate up to 2 additional guest. In addition for your comfort its equipped with a small fridge, personal A/C unit and space heater all for your comfort & enjoyment Beautiful room in a quiet neighborhood furnished with comfortable Queen bed,  large desk, Iron/board night stand w. light. The Bed has an additional pull-out twin size mattress to accommodate extra person. This room is equipped with a small fridge for your use. Enjoy this quiet  and peaceful environment. The living, dining and laundry room is all included for your use. Guests are welcome to use the house and be there during the time you are AirBnbing.  Please be respectful of the other guests st
neighborhood_overview: This quite and historic neighborhood is very well established and is one of the gems in Salem. It is located near state capital building and Salem beautiful parks. The back yard is fully fenced and welcoming for BBQ or out door seating  in shade. Awesome  green views with large trees and squirrels  chasing each other. Very calm and relaxing atmosphere.
notes: The home has 1 permanent tenant. The tenant is very quiet, friendly and mainly keep to him self. you may or may not see them as they are extremely busy work during the day and come home for peaceful night sleep. You're welcome to say hello when and if you see them.
transit: Getting around is very easy with everything being near by.  City Bus is only 300-400 ft away well within walking distance from the house.  All major shopping and grocery centers  are only minutes away. If you are coming from the airport hop on the City Smart bus system and that will take you to and from the airport anytime of the day.   also great walking and biking trails near by for those who are intrested.
access: Guests are welcome to use the house and be there during the time you are AirBnbing.  Please be respectful of the other guests staying in the home by keeping the Noise level low. Please also keep the place clean by not wearing shoes inside.  For your and others safety NO parties, smoking or alcohol is allowed on the property.
interaction: I personally live and stay in Portland but do try to meet with my guests if I can, especially those who stay for longer period of time.  However if you ever need anything or have a question ??? I'm always there to answer via phone or text as i always have my phone on me. In addition my roommate in room 3 whom helps me with Airbnb is also very easy and open to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: -Enjoy your stay. -Respect the place and other guest.  -Clean up after your stay. -Smoking, alcohol,other drugs or weapons is NOT allowed on the property if this is a problem then maybe this is not a good fit for your stay.  -Due to allergies we don't allow pets.
host_about: I am in my early 30's came from a great Biblical missionary family, I enjoy beautiful  Oregon outdoors and different cultural foods. Currently my family and I live and work in Portland.  I have a great house in Salem that we decided to rent out for long and short term via Airbnb i am gone a lot and most of the time i am not in Salem but at my house in Portland . All 5 bedrooms are furnished with welcoming environment for your enjoyable stay.

name: Midcentury Suite with Living Room
summary: Read guest reviews: "Cozy, Clean, Quiet, Comfortable, Convenient and Welcoming!" Perfect for a night or a week! This is the ideal place for one, two or three people. You have your own secure, private space with separate entrance--"sparkling clean with lots of special touches," said one guest.  Please tell me something about yourself, and why you are coming to town!   (Fully licensed by City of Salem, compliant with safety codes.)
space: Two bedrooms are available upstairs with queen bed, and twin bed: simple linens, luggage racks, and ample closet space. Upstairs bathroom has a tub/shower, toilet and basin.  Toiletries, towels and dryer are provided. On lower level: half bathroom, living area with cable television, mini-fridge, and coffee maker, snacks (granola bars, popcorn, yogurt). Nespresso coffee maker, electric kettle, tea, teapot, cream and sweetener. This is a separate space (no one above or below you) with a locked door connecting to my part of the house. A patio outside your living room puts you in a woodland garden. You're welcome to use this space and the garden as your own.

neighborhood_overview: The Suite is three miles from downtown Salem, about an hour from Portland, and about an hour from the Oregon coast. Minto Brown Island Park, which borders the east bank of the Willamette River (1,200 acres of lush, natural open and wooded areas) is less than a mile away. You can walk, jog, or bike along 19 miles of hard and soft trails through native timber and grassy meadows.
access: There is a  separate entrance through the garden. Please note that the walkway to the entrance is stone pavers, and there are stairs from the living room to the bedroom, so this space is not suitable for those with significant mobility challenges. You are welcome to park in front of the house.
interaction: I respect your privacy, and am glad to help you to get the most out of your visit. I may or may not be available to meet you on arrival.
house_rules: Families with children are welcome. Please be aware that the space does not have childproof safety features, and that there are stairs. I enjoy welcoming people of all cultures, religions, ethnicities and gender identities.  Check-in is flexible, usually 5PM-10PM. No smoking. No pets. No parties or events. No drugs. No guest is to sleep overnight on the couch. No burning of candles or incense. This is an entirely smoke-free property.  Only registered guests on premises.  Charge for lost key is $75. Please feel free to come and go as you like, but please do so as quietly as possible for the peace of mind of my neighbors. I appreciate respect and care for my home, and ask that you leave it as you found it.
host_about: I have called many places in the US home. I enjoy creative cooking. My newest hobby is making jams and jellies from the wonderful fruit that grows in the Willamette Valley.  I love to garden, and to read  the treasures snagged on regular trips to Powell's. It's great living in Salem!

name: Private Suite 5 mins to Downtown/40 mins to Coast
summary: My place is close to family-friendly activities and restaurants and dining. You’ll love my place because of the outdoors space and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). It is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood.
space: The bedroom is located in the basement with a fully furnished living room and have its own full bathroom. Guest/s will have the entire basement to themselves.  In the living room, a huge sectional couch that converts into a queen size bed for extra sleeping space. Wi-Fi is available in the bedroom. Washer and dryer is also available for long term guests.

Hi, my name is Delia. I was born and raised in the Philippines. I am an Accountant and my husband, Bob is a Regulatory Manager and are both working for the State of Oregon. We love to travel and meet new people and learn their culture! Our favorite travel destinations are the island of the Philippines, Mexico and Hawaii. "LIFE is short... Have FUN, ENJOY and be HAPPY!"

name: Cozy House in quiet South Salem, private bathroom
summary: Our place is a 4-bedroom, 3-bath ranch house in a shady cul-de-sac in South Salem.  A family of three live in the house occupying two bedrooms. The Airbnb space is opposite the residents’ quarters affording you privacy.  You have your own private bathroom not shared with anyone else. We enjoy hosting our guests.  Our house is walking distance to grocery stores, restaurants, coffee shops/brew pubs. Award winning wineries are within a 10-mile radius. State Capitol, downtown Salem is 5 miles away.
space: Bedrooms are well ventilated and  has lots of natural light.  There are ceiling and floor fans but no A/C in the bedrooms. Both rooms have its own heating system that you can adjust to your liking.    The bedrooms are cozy, clean, comfortable, and quiet. We provide good quality bedsheets, towels, and quilts.  Bathroom has lots of hot water. There is a mini fridge in the guest area.
description: Our place is a 4-bedroom, 3-bath ranch house in a shady cul-de-sac in South Salem.  A family of three live in the house occupying two bedrooms. Bathroom has lots of hot water. There is a mini fridge in the guest area. Guests have access to two living rooms, dining and kitchen areas, back deck and solarium (when weather is nice). Ma
neighborhood_overview: There is a community park a few meters away from our house.  The neighborhood is safe, quiet, friendly, and excellent for walking, running, or exploring. Established neighborhood with a quick and easy access to I-5, Costco, the beautiful Oregon coast, Silver Falls State Park, Riverfront Park, Minto Brown and Bush Parks.
notes: We have a family dog.  Her name is Elie. She is friendly and sweet and  greets everyone by barking at everyone including us when we first get to the house. She would want to sniff you.
transit: Parking is in front of the house along the short stone wall. City bus is available.
access: Guests have access to two living rooms, dining and kitchen areas, back deck and solarium (when weather is nice). Main entry way is shared.  You can make your own coffee on the Keurig machine. Tea is available.
interaction: We enjoy the presence of our guests and sharing our house with them. We will take your lead on the level of interaction and socialization that you prefer. Our family dynamic is relaxed and low key.
house_rules: Please rinse your dishes and utensils and put in dishwasher We recycle cardboard, plastic and food stuff.  We do our best not to wear shoes inside the house. If you are open and comfortable with that, that's great. If not, we will not be offended.
host_about: Easygoing, fun, and warm.  I love jazz, Latin music, and spicy food.  I enjoy gardening, hiking, yoga, and exploring places far and near.

name: Two rooms in historic neighborhood near University
summary: Two spacious rooms in our half finished basement. Perfect if you need a quiet place to rest. In historic neighborhood 5 minutes from I-5. HBO, mini fridge, microwave, and wifi included. Relax on our deck or take a walk to nearby Bush Park! Close to major institutions for the commuter, student, or visiting family. Willamette University, the Capital, and Salem Hospital are about 1 mile away and are walkable through Bush Park. Oregon State Hospital is only 3 miles away on surface streets.
space: Our newly painted, carpeted, and furnished spare basement bed and living rooms are private, cozy, and quiet. There are two windows to let in natural light and can be opened for fresh air.  The rooms stay nice and cool in the day and are comfortable at night. There are two radiant heaters installed in the both rooms to adjust the warmth to your liking.  An inconvenience is that the guest bathroom is on the first floor, but we keep it prepared for guests only as we have a second bathroom on the second floor. Towels and toiletries are available if you need them.  There is a mini fridge/freezer, microwave, and a living room with a 42" flat screen and HBO On Demand. For a third guest, we have a nice inflatable twin air mattress and a comfortable couch as options.
description: Two spacious rooms in our half finished basement. Perfect if you need a quiet place to rest. In historic neighborhood 5 minutes from I-5. HBO, mini fridge, microwave, and wifi included. Relax on our deck or take a walk to nearby Bush Park! Close to major institutions for the commuter, student, or visiting family. Willamette University, the Capital, and Salem Hospital are about 1 mile away and are walkable through Bush Park. Oregon State Hospital is only 3 miles away on surface streets. Our newly painted, carpeted, and furnished spare basement bed and living rooms are private, cozy, and quiet. There are two windows to let in natural light and can be opened for fresh air.  The rooms stay nice and cool in the day and are comfortable at night. There are two radiant heaters installed in the both rooms to adjust the warmth to your liking.  An inconvenience is that the guest bathroom is on the first floor, but we keep it prepared for guests only as we have a second bathroom on the second floo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is old and beautiful! Quiet, friendly, and safe. I love to walk the tree shaded streets among the historic homes.  Bush Park is a gorgeous 5 minute walk away. You can spend hours exploring the grounds which are across the street from Willamette University and the state Capitol.  There is a running track, tennis courts, and grassy football field at the high school about 100 yards from our house. They are open to the public usually when school is not is session. We have rackets and tennis balls for use. There are also a couple of gyms very close that offer day passes.
notes: We have one cat, Karl. He is friendly...Don't worry about letting him in or out, he is ok with either.  We also have two children, Jackson (10) and Zoe (7). They are friendly and respectful. They have early bedtimes and know to be mindful when we have guests.  After 3pm on school days and occasionally on weekends the kids have friends over.  Our two showers share the same water heater. We try to stagger or bathing so our guests have enough hot water, typically around 6:30-7 AM and then 8-9:30 PM. Anytime between there will be plenty of hot water! We're definitely a functional home and an active family. The basement space is yours but we always love to chat and welcome you!
transit: The city bus stop is about a quarter mile down the street. Please note that it does not run on weekends.  The city library is about a 10 minute walk, but very easy to get to with only one major street to cross.  There are many amazing restaurants downtown. Mexican, Indian, Thai, Chinese, and other fine dining. Coffee houses and huts. We know all the best and will fill you in.
access: Our basement is accessed from the front door, through the kitchen and down the stairs. We're OK with guests coming in later as long as we know so that we can keep a light on for you.  Wifi is available throughout house and is also for guest use.  Kitchen: full amenities including Keurig and Vitamix. We don't keep a large stock of food, but cereal etc. is free to guests. Backyard: deck, fire pit, BBQ, grassy yard Washer/dryer and iron/board in basement available for use.  Street parking pass available for dash. The parking patrol comes by between 8AM and 3 PM on weekdays. Please return before checkout.  The first floor bathroom is for guests. Towels and toiletries provided.  Basement and main floor living areas are open. We keep board games in your room and have tons of books!
interaction: We are a friendly, laid back family. You're welcome to hang out and chat or take time to yourself. Sometimes we're in, sometimes we're out. But you're always welcome! Our schedule is pretty typical. Usually in bed by 11PM and up by 6:30 AM.
house_rules: No illegal drugs or excessive alcohol. Smoking ok in the backyard.  No outside guests.  Pets ok if they are clean and taken care of. When checking out, please leave the parking pass on the dresser downstairs or by the front door.  Ok to come back late, just let us know so that we can leave the door open and a light on for you.

name: Light filled Art Loft on Fairmount Hill
summary: The Art Loft is located in the cozy historic Fairmount Hill neighborhood.   We are close to City Center, Bush Park, Willamette University, and the Convention Center.   The loft is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers by offering a private entrance with treetop views. Enjoy a nice secluded stay adventure.
space: Our light-filled North-facing studio with large windows is a modern detached space that includes a comfy queen bed, wood stripped ceilings, hardwood floors, air conditioning, full bathroom, kitchenette, small sitting area and french doors that lead to the outdoor sitting area in our private backyard.  It’s a perfect studio size space that is well utilized. The kitchenette includes a small fridge, stone counters, stainless sink, toaster, coffee maker, coffee press, electric tea kettle and microwave.  We will get you started with creamer, almond milk, yogurt and granola.  Complementary tea and coffee are provided along with a long list of restaurant recommendations.  Conveniences include a flat screen TV, stereo, wifi internet along with Salem/Portland maps and guides. Our loft feels like home and an ideal retreat space after a long day.  - NO SMOKING. Smoking is not permitted. Sorry, no pets allowed. If you like animals, you can always say hi to our friendly dog Gramps, who likes to han
description: The Art Loft is located in the cozy historic Fairmount Hill neighborhood.   We are close to City Center, Bush Park, Willamette University, and the Convention Center.   The loft is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers by offering a private entrance with treetop views. Enjoy a nice secluded stay adventure. Our light-filled North-facing studio with large windows is a modern detached space that includes a comfy queen bed, wood stripped ceilings, hardwood floors, air conditioning, full bathroom, kitchenette, small sitting area and french doors that lead to the outdoor sitting area in our private backyard.  It’s a perfect studio size space that is well utilized. The kitchenette includes a small fridge, stone counters, stainless sink, toaster, coffee maker, coffee press, electric tea kettle and microwave.  We will get you started with creamer, almond milk, yogurt and granola.  Complementary tea and coffee are provided along with a long list of restaurant recommendations
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Salem-- just a quick distance from all you could possibly want for shops, restaurants, bars, music venues, parks, playgrounds, many within walking distance.  Our neighborhood is a great place to take a walk to see beautiful homes with diverse architecture.
notes: We love the idea of recycling so our floor is a re-purposed racquetball court with red squares throughout. When looking down into our backyard, you'll see lawn chairs made from antique waterskis and various sculptures made by artists from around Oregon. All the artwork in the loft has been created by Northwest artists.  I would love to share any information on them and give you information about their studios.   We are business traveler friendly.  We are close to downtown, Salem Hospital, Willamette University and State Buildings.   You can retreat to our space in the quiet Fairmount neighborhood after a long day of work.
transit: We live in a cozy neighborhood that is not far from our downtown, Willamette University and the Riverfront.  If there's a place you want to go, just ask and we will give assistance.  We will give you a free pass to Willamette University's Hallie Ford Art Museum which is located in the heart of downtown Salem and near Oregon's Capitol.  The museum's collection reflect the Pacific Northwest culture and explore the art from around the world.  Only an hour's drive from the Pacific coast, the Cascade mountains, or Portland's many food, brew, literary, hip culture attractions.  Salem is easy to get around with plenty of historic buildings, parks and gardens. From the house you can walk to all services you need.  Be sure and check out the many wineries that surround the Willamette Valley!
access: You are welcomed to hang out in our backyard to relax.  If weather permits, we may have a backyard fire in the evening at the fire pit.
interaction: We are close by and you can send a text or just come to the back door and knock.   We are easy going and are here to make your stay comfortable.  We are happy to give directions, tell you about our neighborhood and surrounding area so don't hesitate to ask.   We are around most of the time so you might see us working in the yard, painting in the studio or walking Gramps (the dog).   Once you are here, we will give you the wifi password.
house_rules: - Check-in is after 4PM - Respect for neighbors - No Pets, No Tobacco - Quiet time is from 10 PM - 8 AM - No unregistered guests after 10 PM. - Enjoy your stay.   - Leave our space how you would hope to find it the next time you stay. - Check out is 11AM
host_about:
I am a gallery owner in Oregon and love seeing art from all over the world.  My hope is to visit the many airbnb's that are owned by those that appreciate the arts.  
My husband and I are easy going and love to explore the places we visit.  We like to check out the architecture, the arts and unique shopping (we aren't interested in shopping malls).  We love renting bikes and exploring.  
My website is (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You can get a good idea of who I am by visiting my blog that is on the website.  Thank you again for considering us.
Mary Lou

name: Ben Lomond House
summary: Welcome! This beautiful house will be a home away from home. Past guest reviews confirm that this home is an ideal family gathering spot as well as a quiet space for relaxation or work. The well appointed kitchen, extremely comfortable beds in large bedrooms, wood burning fireplace, grand piano, and numerous spaces for relaxation make this home very desirable. Past guests include multi-generational families, attorneys, professionals attending conferences, and recording artists.
space: The home is on a quiet, secluded street in a neighborhood that is a mix of historic homes including the Governor's Mansion as well as other nice homes built during this century. Adults tend to comment on the master suite with view of the gardens through the bay window, numerous dining spots, beds and linens, and genuine works of art adorning the walls. Kids are drawn to the lofts in upstairs bedrooms, the tower room, balcony, and toys and games. One block away is a nice park adjoining a turn of the century school with playground; four blocks away numerous dining options can be found, including the best coffee house/creperie and a restaurant with 20 beers on tap. Wine country starts just outside city limits and Portland and the Oregon Coast are a one hour drive away.

transit: Off-street parking for two cars, three in a pinch, but we would need to discuss that first (no parking on street). Public transportation is three blocks away.
access: The entire home is yours.
house_rules: *2 cars. 3 absolute maximum and we will have to discuss how to fit them in. *Please leave the house in approximately the same condition it was in. *No parties of any kind.  Please keep noise down when coming and going and when on the porches. Please be mindful of the impact your group has on the neighborhood. We want to be able to continue hosting guests and this depends on our neighbors continuing to enjoy their residential neighborhood. This is why we *don't allow parties of any sort* in the house. A party can be loud and impact other people living in the building or the neighborhood, even if there is no music on and you are just hanging out drinking and talking.  Please be mindful of noise when you go in and out and especially late at night and *keep the noise low.* You will notice that no one else in the neighborhood makes noise when the enter or leave their homes, and it's important that the neighborhood stay that way. If you view your stay as living in a quiet neighborhood rather

name: The Salem Treehouse
summary: Private entrance Master Studio with loft. Feels like your own cabin in the mountains. Enjoy the view of the stars each night on your private deck.   Let the beautiful wood surround you in quiet happiness as you grab a book and relax in the comfy recliner or sink into the plush King bed.
space: Private entrance Master Studio with loft. Feels like your own cabin in the mountains. Enjoy the view of the stars each night on your private deck.   Let the beautiful wood surround you in quiet happiness as you grab a book and relax in the comfy recliner or sink into the plush King bed. Private back stair entrance and deck, lead you inside to high ceilings and wood beam accents creates an atmosphere of your own private cabin in the woods.  The giant king bed is like melting into a pillow. (If you want firm, climb up to the loft)  The loft area is fun for kids traveling with you or an extra guest who doesn't mind an air mattress with sleeping bag. (The ladder is steep, pls keep don't wear slippery socks or horse play) There is a desk for work, a recliner for reading and relaxing.  WiFi, Mini fridge, microwave, toaster  and coffee maker all there ready for you. house_rules: Maintain the quiet energy of the property and neighbors. No crazy loud music or parties. Professional suite. A family lives in the other portion of the home. neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a middle-class neighborhood so it is pretty quiet.
notes: We have four cats; I mention this because some people are allergic to cats. Summers can be very hot in Salem, so Michele does her best by opening / closing doors and windows and running fans at certain times, but we do not have a cooling system, so even with all of Michele's efforts, it is still pretty hot.
transit: Bus stop is 200 meters from house. Visit Cherriots for public transportation details. Parking is available on street in front of our home.
access: The shared main bathroom / water closet / restroom with shower is right across the hallway from guest room. We also have a small room with only a toilet and sink (half bathroom) near the laundry room and garage.
interaction: Cisco Linksys Router WiFi connects automatically to your devices. I work Monday through Friday, but Michele will be home to greet you. I handle the computer end of AirBnB but Michele handles everything else. Michele is even happy to do your laundry for you, baby sit, make you coffee and tea and whatever else you want.
house_rules: - Non-Smokers Only. Please acknowledge that you are non-smoker in your first communication with us. - Bringing your baby along? No problem! We can accommodate two adult guests plus one baby. We have a baby crib we could bring down from attic at no extra charge. - Absolutely no smoking allowed anywhere on the property, not even in the yard. We decline smokers because the stench of tobacco smoke permeates clothing and would end up in our home, so if you are a smoker, please look for some other place. Please acknowledge that you are non-smoker in your first communication with us. - No illegal drug use allowed. No loud parties allowed. Peace and quite is the theme here. - It is OK to arrive after check-in window due to late flight or other circumstances beyond your control. Just let us know.
host_about: Hi. My name is David. My wife is Michele. We have four cats. We live in Salem Oregon. I work for the state processing infrastructure and water system contracts. My passion is metrication. I try to convince Americans to get rid of silly Fahrenheit and inches and miles and gallons et cetera and embrace the International System. My favorite travel destination is France. I love Europe. I like spicy food. I love the music of Beethoven and Chopin. The people I admire the most are Sam Harris (American author, philosopher and neuroscientist) and Bill Maher (American comedian and political commentator). I always watch the Daily Show with Trevor Noah. My wife Michele loves Stephen King books and movies and John Oliver (English comedian and political commentator) and Bill Maher. Michele and I visited Iceland in April 2016 and we really love Iceland.

name: 1926 Craftsman: Oregon Hospitality w/ Private Bath
summary: ATTENTION: Recently, a main water line burst in our home causing catastrophic damage, requiring us to find other lodging for our current guest as well as cancel a future reservation, and resulted in us losing us our SUPERHOST status. We hope to be up and running again by December. Located p within walking distance of Salem’s downtown amenities, make this your home base for exploring the area. Wake up to a garden-fresh breakfast, then allow the fully jetted hot tub to melt your cares away.
space: The main level guest room overlooks the back garden and hot tub area, and includes the adjacent, private, vintage bathroom. A new convenient charging station makes it easy to charge your electronic devices. A smart TV (with Netflicks) is available in the living room. Coffee and tea are available 24/7... and for the health-conscious, ask about our nutrient packed, garden-fresh breakfast smoothies. I enjoy making breakfasts and can offer a variety of options to suit most dietary restrictions and tastes.  Our location is ideal for walking downtown and exploring many nearby beautiful parks. Interested in a bike ride? We also have two bicycles that you may borrow (upon request). There are wonderful, scenic trails nearby. We also have a treadmill and home gym for you to use if the weather turns rainy.  Want to meditate? Our ergonomic lounge in the parlor is ideal, next to a stereo for playing serene music. We want our guests to feel welcome and comfortable in our home and we want this experi
description: ATTENTION: Recently, a main water line burst in our home causing catastrophic damage, requiring us to find other lodging for our current guest as well as cancel a future reservation, and resulted in us losing us our SUPERHOST status. We hope to be up and running again by December. Located p within walking distance of Salem’s downtown amenities, make this your home base for exploring the area. Wake up to a garden-fresh breakfast, then allow the fully jetted hot tub to melt your cares away. The main level guest room overlooks the back garden and hot tub area, and includes the adjacent, private, vintage bathroom. A new convenient charging station makes it easy to charge your electronic devices. A smart TV (with Netflicks) is available in the living room. Coffee and tea are available 24/7... and for the health-conscious, ask about our nutrient packed, garden-fresh breakfast smoothies. I enjoy making breakfasts and can offer a variety of options to suit most dietary restrictions and tastes.
neighborhood_overview: Our strategic location makes a great home base to explore the area's amenities, including many parks, wineries, restaurants and the Salem Convention Center, which is just a 10-minute walk away.
notes: Ask about my super-healthy breakfast smoothy using nutrient-packed, home-grown ingredients. Coffee/tea/water is available throughout the day upon request. Don't have a car? No problem. Salem's now offers UBER and LYFT.
transit: There is a bus stop two blocks from our home. Most everything you need is within walking and/or biking distance. Salem now offers UBER and LYFT, for those who need transport, but won't be bringing their vehicle.
access: Make yourself comfortable in our parlor, living room, dining room, guest bedroom/bathroom and back garden.
interaction: I work from my home office, so I'm readily available and easily reachable. I thoroughly enjoy one-on-one conversation, to get to know you better. I have personally explored many of Salem's local amenities and am happy to offer recommendations. In the guest room, I've compiled and organized a guest packet which contains brochures of what I consider to be the best options. I thoroughly enjoy stimulating conversation, but I am respectful to those guests who prefer more privacy. Would you like a family-style, home-cooked dinner? That can be arranged. Ask for details when you arrive.
house_rules: Late arrivals (after 10 pm) will incur an additional fee of $20.
host_about:
Author and graphic designer, Wendy, enjoys welcoming guests into her home, providing healthy breakfasts and a positively memorable experience. Little details like personal robes, hooks (for hanging toiletry bags) and a red nightlight (that won't interrupt the body's melatonin production) in the guest's private bathroom are just some the extras available to help make guests feel extra special. Friendly Co-host, Michael, is an US Army veteran, is superb at providing directions and instructions on hot tub usage, etc. Wendy and Mike enjoy conversing with guests - especially over a glass of Oregon wine. But we also respect those who prefer quiet solitude and are sensitive to their needs as well. Wendy's interests include gardening, cooking, reading, exploring, and more. Her quirky passions include '80s British sitcoms and a fascination of the unusual, unexplained and/or bizarre. If you've got a strange story to share, you'll have a captive audience here. 
So, look no further ... if you have a calendar date in mind for your next getaway to Salem, please book it now while it's still available.

name: Inspiring room in Central Salem
summary: This room inspires with it's writing desk, musical instruments and sight of the book-laden porch. It is located in the front of our home with a door opening onto the sitting room. Room darkening curtains also allow for mornings of sleeping in. The bed is a comfortable, futon from IKEA, allowing two people to spent the night comfortably. There is space enough for a doggie, if your friend travels with you. We are registered with the City of Salem: License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) LI.
space: This is a 1925 Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sun porch, sitting space on the back yard patio and a secluded lounging area with fire pit (and PLENTY of wood).
description: This room inspires with it's writing desk, musical instruments and sight of the book-laden porch. It is located in the front of our home with a door opening onto the sitting room. Room darkening curtains also allow for mornings of sleeping in. The bed is a comfortable, futon from IKEA, allowing two people to spent the night comfortably. There is space enough for a doggie, if your friend travels with you. We are registered with the City of Salem: License # (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) LI. This is a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sun porch, sitting space on the back yard patio and a secluded lounging area with fire pit (and PLENTY of wood). Your bedroom is in the front of the house, off of the living room. You will share the upstairs of th
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbors and our neighborhood. Tree-lined streets, sidewalks, and quiet. We love how central it is to most things in Salem. And we love how central Salem is to most things in western Oregon. The neighborhood and Salem is overall very safe but cars have had things disappear when people forget to lock!
notes: A newly installed furnace and AC keeps the house enjoyable all year round. To cater for individual needs, both fans and space heaters are available. We have a new labradoodle puppy as of January 2019. He is very chill and we look forward to training him amidst our family of Airbnb guests! Please socialize with him if you get the chance and have the desire. He is a future therapy dog so the more interaction the better.
transit: Both Lyft and Uber are available. Public buses are close by. The Amtrak Station/Greyhound Station is within a 10 minute walk. It is a 5-8 minute walk to convenience stores and the famous breakfast restaurant Word of Mouth, 20 minute walk to the grocery store, and 25 minutes to downtown. The state capital is about 15 minutes away and Willamette University takes only 10 minutes on foot. Bicycles and kayaks available for use with advanced notice.
access: Your bedroom is in the front of the house, off of the living room. You will share the upstairs of the house with up to two other guests. The owners might be hanging around upstairs for cooking and socializing. The kitchen is fully available for use. Arnaud is quite the culinary adventurer and loves to share his kitchen. The shared bathroom comes with an old style crowfoot bathtub and shower.  Our house has multiple spaces, offering a choice to either be by yourselves (backyard, side yard, front porch) or to interact with hosts and guests. We have hosted many Couchsurfers through the years and love to talk about travel. Laundry utilities are availble in the basement for those in need of it.
interaction: We are always available via text, phone, or Airbnb site. We always try to be at the house to welcome and orient guests however if not, we will provide you with a code to our lock box.
house_rules: We love this house and we hope you will love it too. It is truly a "home" in every sense of the word. Please respect the space as you would your own home.
host_about: We enjoy traveling to different countries, mostly to know the people who live there. It just so happened that Christy traveled to Europe in 2015 and met Arnaud in Belgium. We rent our house to commuters and friends so we're very used to shared spaces/renting private rooms. When we travel, we rent out the entire house. Music and learning and relationships are other passions in life. Mix all that in with some good scenery, interesting food, and drinks and we're in heaven.

interaction: I am home a lot when I am not cycling. Love meeting guests and enjoying my morning coffee with them.
house_rules: - Check-in flexible if pre-arranged.
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: The Art Room
summary: This is a beautiful private room filled with art, light and plants that will calm your soul. The Himalayan Salt Lamp and the Down Comforter will make you experience a luxurious sleep. The room has a private entrance and lots of books. Our house is well located, we are a couple of blocks away from Oregon State Fair, 5 minutes drive to Salem downtown, and 4 minutes to I-5. Ask us to lend you our tandem bike if you are visiting with your partner.
space: We try to make our home a comfortable, quiet and peaceful place. We love plants, art and baking. The room is serene with a comfortable bed, overlooking our backyard. We have a flock of friendly chickens and an outdoor cat named Marvin. We also have two professional roommates that live in the second floor.

name: Writer's corner room
summary: Relax in this private room overlooking the garden and creek. The futon bed is plain yet comfortable and hosts are welcoming and full of ideas for what to do on your visit. Feel free to use the kitchen and living room to make yourself at home. Not a lot of frills here, but we are happy to accommodate special requests. We are LGBTQ friendly! (Licensed with the City of Salem.)
space: The bedroom and bathroom are upstairs on the second floor. There is an additional half-bathroom off the downstairs kitchen you can also use if you like. The living room has couches, books, and games, but note that we don't have a television (on purpose - we like it that way). In the summer you can sit on the swing in the back and listen to the creek, eat outside at the picnic table, or hang out with us around the fire pit.

We live in this house as our primary residence, so you'll likely see us coming and going, or hanging out in the living room. Feel free to join us if you'd like! Location is in Central Salem and an
neighborhood_overview: Location is in Central Salem and an easy on/off from I-5 and Hwy 22. Off-street parking for your car (please park on right half of driveway). There is a park and playground on the next block and several fast food restaurants within a few blocks. The street is secluded with very little traffic, but we do have close neighbors, including some with dogs that may bark.
transit: The public transportation in Salem isn't great (only works on weekdays), but there is a bus route nearby. The house is about a 20-30 minute walk from downtown, Willamette University, Bush Park, and the Salem Hospital. It is walkable to the Amtrak & Greyhound station. You are welcome to park in our driveway.
interaction: We live in this house as our primary residence, so you'll likely see us coming and going, or hanging out in the living room. Feel free to join us if you'd like!
house_rules: No outside guests allowed on the property without prior approval by host. Park your car on the right side of the garage. Please be respectful of neighbors. Quiet time after 10 pm. Do not place anything in front of the heater.
host_about: I love Salem and have lived here for over 10 years. I work in the field of social work. I work hard and love to use AirBnB to get away so I can recharge and be ready to face all the joy and hurt in the world. I try to be a good neighbor, volunteer, or just a good person to have around in a pinch. When I have time to relax, I like to be outdoors, hiking, kayaking, snowshoeing, camping, or just curled up with a good book.

name: Paxson House - Toscono Room
summary: Step into the oasis of a welcoming room in our beautiful classic craftsman home in South Salem. Even though we're on a busy corner, we've created a sanctuary in the well appointed Italian-themed rooms. You have access to a comfy living room downstairs and our entire backyard, patio with Traeger grill and secluded garden  & fountain. Toscono room is air conditioned, has free wi-fi access, internet TV, recliner. bathrobes and Keurig for your enjoyment. Near to great restaurants and wineries
space: Specialty full breakfast available for $10.00 per person extra on request. Continental breakfast included.
description: Step into the oasis of a welcoming room in our beautiful classic craftsman home in South Salem. Even though we're on a busy corner, we've created a sanctuary in the well appointed Italian-themed rooms. You have access to a comfy living room downstairs and our entire backyard, patio with Traeger grill and secluded garden  & fountain. Toscono room is air conditioned, has free wi-fi access, internet TV, recliner. bathrobes and Keurig for your enjoyment. access: You will have access to our living room, outdoor garden and patio and secluded fountain sitting area. By request, kitchen facilities can be made available. Toscano Room is a shared bathroom, where as Giardino Room is a private bathroom
host_about:
Your hosts, Tim and Connie combine their artistic skills to create an atmosphere of welcoming and ambience of warmth and relaxation. Tim's love of photography and Connie's hospitality and catering background blend to make Paxson House a natural choice for travelers or that special occasion getaway. We feel that we are stewards of this classic home that "wrap its arms around you." Our trip to Italy inspired us to decorate with the themed old world charm. 
   Respecting the privacy of our guests, we set the stage, yet are available to answer questions or provide suggestions of local activities and/or venues.
   Tim and Connie love to explore new eateries and wineries, cycling, and travel. We also love to dance.  Connie and Tim are both writers. Connie is a stylist with an innovative clothing company.  Tim is a safety consultant. We have named our home "Paxson House for two reasons:  It is named after the original owner Glenn Paxson 2, who was the State of Oregon Bridge Engineer.  Also, Paxson can be translated "Son of Peace"  which we hope you sense when you step through the door.

name: Country Garden Retreat
summary: This spacious retreat offers everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay in a country garden setting within easy walking distance of Corban University. Stargazers and eclipse-watchers will appreciate the open sky views.
space: Our South Salem home is situated just outside city limits. The ground floor of this large house is all yours with over 1200 square feet of interior space. Our one-acre lot features lush flower gardens, a large berry patch (in the summer, you can pick fresh blackberries or raspberries for your breakfast!), and lots of room to kick back and relax. Come and go as you please through a separate private entrance.
description: This spacious retreat offers everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay in a country garden setting within easy walking distance of Corban University. Stargazers and eclipse-watchers will appreciate the open sky views. Our South Salem home is situated just outside city limits. The ground floor of this large house is all yours with over 1200 square feet of interior space. Our one-acre lot features lush flower gardens, a large berry patch (in the summer, you can pick fresh blackberries or raspberries for your breakfast!), and lots of room to kick back and relax. Come and go as you please through a separate private entrance. Sleep tight in a quiet and cool bedroom with a new, comfortable queen bed and luxury linens. A twin air bed is also available on request.  It is very comfortable, especially with the twin bed mattress topper.  Enjoy a private bathroom and shower, wifi access, extra-large living room with flat-screen TV featuring 200 satellite channels, dining table and kitchenet
neighborhood_overview: We're in the country just enough to feel quiet and spacious, yet still conveniently located for easy freeway access and multiple shopping and dining options. - walk to Corban University - Willamette University is 5.7 miles away - downtown Salem is 7 miles away - hiking and biking opportunities abound in easy driving distance, including the Riverfront City Park, Silver Falls State Park and the Oregon Garden. - an hour's drive from Portland - 65 miles to the Oregon Coast (Lincoln City is the nearest beach) - Portland International Airport (PDX) 63.5 miles away - Eugene Airport (check out Allegiant Airlines for cheap flights) is 68 miles away
notes: Our kitchenette is equipped with a microwave, toaster, small refrigerator, coffee pot and a big jug of fresh well water. Please note that there is no kitchen sink or stove, so it is not suitable for cooking other than reheating.  Snack on crackers, cheese and fruit when you arrive. Cereal and milk, coffee and tea (brew your own) are all provided for your breakfast. Let us know in advance if you'd like to use the twin air mattress as a separate sleeping option - we'll be happy to have it ready for you.
transit: Uber or a taxi are your best options if you need public transportation.
access: Sleep tight in a quiet and cool bedroom with a new, comfortable queen bed and luxury linens. A twin air bed is also available on request.  It is very comfortable, especially with the twin bed mattress topper.  Enjoy a private bathroom and shower, wifi access, extra-large living room with flat-screen TV featuring 200 satellite channels, dining table and kitchenette. In good weather, take advantage of our outdoor fire pit - sip a glass of wine, roast hot dogs or toast marshmallows while you watch the sunset!  Wood is provided for your use.
interaction: We live upstairs when we have guests, so we're nearby if you need something - just text, call, or knock on the front door. We love meeting and chatting with guests but will always respect your privacy. Outdoor space is shared, so we may see you in the garden.
house_rules: - Please leave shoes by the door to avoid tracking dirt through the space.  - No loud noise after 9pm. - No smoking in or around the house at any time.  - We have a 2-guest limit, however, if you wish to sleep in separate beds, we have a twin-size air mattress available for your use.
host_about:
Tom and I are originally from the Portland area and have lived in Salem for over 40 years. We raised our three sons here and now enjoy the quiet, natural setting full of hummingbirds, woodpeckers and deer. This place is like our own private park. 

We've got loads of flowers here. Over the years, Tom has planted apple and cherry trees, a plum tree, a fig tree, rhubarb, herbs and tomatoes, and a big berry patch full of blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, strawberries and currants. We like to call it "Tom's Berry Farm" but it isn't really a farm - though we sometimes joke that we could probably open up a roadside stand with all the produce.

Family is the most important thing to us and we enjoy spending time with our kids and grand kids. Other interests include cooking, reading, salmon fishing and volunteering for local charities like the Marion County Food Bank and Assistance League.

Our youngest son introduced us to Airbnb and we're excited for the opportunity to meet new people and share our peaceful home.

name: Spacious Cottage in South Salem
summary: Tucked into the corner of a beautiful property, guests are assured of privacy and accessibility to all the Willamette Valley has to offer. If you're here for business or vacationing, we think our spot in the neighborhood is helpful! We are just a 10 minute drive from the State Capitol and downtown Salem. No doubt about it...our cottage is conveniently located.
space: This spacious 1 bedroom cottage has a full living area, kitchenette (with a full size fridge), and laundry facilities.  You will enjoy a full master bedroom with a master bath! Downstairs, there is room for sipping coffee, a breakfast nook and lounging about.

name: Large private, scenic waterfront suite.
summary: We welcome you to stay in our large, cozy in-law suite. Its expansive main window overlooks a beautiful koi pond, as well as a clear view of Salem's Mill Creek. Enjoy these sights while relaxing in our hammock or chair swing. Salem's downtown, Willamette University and the fairgrounds are all in walking/biking distance. At night, take in a magical view of the many garden lights throughout. You will have use of a full private bathroom, a washer/dryer, and, in the bedroom, a TV, kitchen and wifi.
space: Our serene pond and waterfront setting is the perfect place to escape the city, yet it is within walking and biking distance to Salem's downtown attractions, university and the state fairgrounds. You can have the best of both worlds with our idyllic space. There is a coded private entrance that is well-lit at night for guests arriving after dark and parking for two vehicles. The TV is set up with Netflix, HBO, Hulu, Amazon and several other entertainment offerings.

neighborhood_overview: We are the platform 9 3/4 of State street. We are in the city, yet the house feels as though it is in the middle of the woods. It allows for the perfect combination of urban and woodland experiences.
notes: Our home is located straight at the end of Wander Way. Our house number is displayed both in the front yard next to the arched trellis and next to the front door. Unlike a traditional B&B, we do not serve guests a full breakfast. However, we do try to ensure there is oatmeal, breakfast bars or perhaps fruit in the room.  Litter boxes are regularly cleaned and kept below the red stairs to the hosts' level. To prevent our 2 curious cats from accessing your bedroom and bathroom, keep all basement level doors closed during your stay. Although we take great effort to mitigate any odor, guests will occasionally catch notice of the liter box smell while briefly going from the bedroom to the bathroom. Please keep this in mind if you're unfamiliar with cats, or especially bothered by these smells.
transit: Parking is on the property and public transportation is one block away. Bikes are welcome and can be stored inside the property.
access: Guests will have access to the basement suite (includes sink, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker and dishes) the laundry room, and a full bathroom. There is a loveseat in the space near the tv. Guests will also have access to relax and dine on the lower deck at the covered patio table in our tranquil backyard.
interaction: Whenever possible, we make a point to be available when a guest arrives to introduce ourselves, show them to the room and assist with any luggage. Throughout the stay, we are available 24 hours a day to respond to any requests, and are always happy to recommend local restaurants, pubs, shops and other preferred attractions.
house_rules: - Read our arrival instructions fully. - Any doors and windows which do not have a screen are to remain closed at all times. This includes at check in.  - Keep noise at a respectful volume after 10pm. - Do not flush feminine hygeine products. Please dispose of them discreetly and safely. This also includes feminine/baby wipes/facial tissue. Only toilet paper we provide and human waste may be flushed down the toilet. No double or triple ply. - Ensure exterior door is locked and lights/appliances are all turned off when you are not in the room.  - Personal belongings must remain in guest spaces. - No fires may be set on the property. - Guests are expected to dispose of their rubbish in the appropriate bins - Smoking permitted outside only with safe disposal of butts/ashes. - Keep throw blankets and bedding off of the floor. - Follow all requests to adjust your parking so that our neighbors are not inconvenienced during your stay. Our property is located in a cozy and secluded area, and p
host_about: An Artist (painting/drawing) and a Language Arts Public School teacher. Introverted types who enjoy photography, hiking, kayaking, bike riding, making art, binge watching well written shows, live music, npr, and a chill night at an eye-catching bar. Relocated to Pacific NW in early 2015 from Baltimore. Loving this side of the country!

Visit the State Hospital site of the filming One Flew Over the Coocoo’s Nest and tour the museum.  Take a ride on a riverboat, or ride a handcrafted wooden carousel horse at River Front Park.  Scenic 60-minute drive to Portland.

notes: Communal areas are shared and cared for by homeowner. Being mindful of the house rules, is greatly appreciated, as this is shared space. In addition, this is one room of the two, that are listed at the Historic Bungalow. So, there may be another Airbnb guest when you’re staying. Feel free to ask, if another guest is booked at the same time.

access: Kitchen, Living Room, Bathroom and backyard.
interaction: If, I'm not here when you arrive, feel free to text or call me with any questions or concerns.
house_rules: Please remove your shoes while in te house.  Quiet hours begin at 10pm. You may come to the house later, just be mindful to not watch the tv or play music loudly.  There is a compost pail on the kitchen counter for the coffee grains and recycle bins are provided, using them is greatly appreciated. Once you open the kitchen door, the recycle bins are located to the left of the stairs. Please only use the plates, cups and silverware provided in the coffee/tea station.  Please hand wash the dishes/silverware after use and place to dry in the dishwasher. Feel free to use the cookware in the kitchen, except the cast iron skillets.  Please leave the tub, free of hair, and the bathroom clean after use.  Please store food in the refrigerator, provided in the room. Please don't eat the food in the main refrigerator.  Please store toiletries and towels/wash cloths in the Airbnb room and not in the restroom.  No other guests except for those authorized through Airbnb,  unless previously arranged.
host_about: I’m a Floridian who is residing in Salem, OR. Traveling, cooking, hiking, outdoor cycling, photography and whiskey tasting are a few of my hobbies. Meeting people of different walks of life has made for great conversations. My goal as a host is to make people welcomed in my home, whether I’m physically present or not.

summary: Located on a quiet street, my home is open to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean, and conveniently located place to stay while visiting Salem and surrounding area.
space: Brand new washer and dryer Kitchen for your personal use Driveway parking and may use garage Wi Fi Netflix Only

You may park your vehicle in the garage as well. The kitchen is fully stocked and you are welcome to eat and/or cook any food available.  Typical household condiments and coffee and tea is provided. I and/or my backup are available during your stay. My home is located on a quiet street close to food, fuel and shopping. Salem is expanding with new restaurants and coffee shops: Rafn's and Archive are two of my favorites. But don't forget Kim Huong (Vietnamese), Wild Pear (Northwest cuisine), Ritter's (pizza + vegetarian) and Word of Mouth (the breakfast spot).  Bush Park and the Waterfront Park offer trails, playgrounds, and grass space - great f
neighborhood_overview: My home is located on a quiet street close to food, fuel and shopping. Salem is expanding with new restaurants and coffee shops: Rafn's and Archive are two of my favorites. But don't forget Kim Huong (Vietnamese), Wild Pear (Northwest cuisine), Ritter's (pizza + vegetarian) and Word of Mouth (the breakfast spot).  Bush Park and the Waterfront Park offer trails, playgrounds, and grass space - great for individuals and families.  Looking to explore outside of Salem? Head an hour south to Corvallis, home of the Oregon State Beavers, Eugene, home of the Oregon Ducks, or an hour North to Portland, foodie paradise and more.
notes: If you are a traveling nurse, this is an ideal  home for your 13 week rotation! Willamette University parents:  You are a quick 4 mile drive to your student!  You are also in walking distance to a gas station, McDonalds, Wal-Mart, Applebee’s, Dutch Brother’s Coffee and 2 pizzerias.  Very easy access to I5, both south and north entrance/exit ramps.
access: You have access to the entire home including a spacious backyard.  You may park your vehicle in the garage as well. The kitchen is fully stocked and you are welcome to eat and/or cook any food available.  Typical household condiments and coffee and tea is provided.
interaction: I and/or my backup are available during your stay.
host_about:
Hi!

Five years ago, the travel bug hit me, and I spent six months in Thailand, before venturing throughout the United States and then spending another three months in Thailand, Cambodia and Malaysia. I grew up on Air Force bases in Alaska, California, Florida, Washington, Oregon and the Philippine Islands.

I want to open up my home so that others can experience an authentic travel experience while visiting Oregon, a truly beautiful state, if I do say so myself!  Salem is the capitol of Oregon and approximately 45 miles south of our beloved Portland and an hour from our stunning coast.

I am happy to answer any of your questions or share any tips about the area; please do not hesitate to reach out to me. 

And thank you for looking at my listing.

Victoria

name: Spacious South Salem Home
summary: Charming 1950's home in  the heart of South Salem. Walking distance to transportation, shopping, dinning, nightlife, parks, and more. Minutes from downtown by car, less than an hour to Portland, the Oregon coast, Silver creek falls, and a plethora of great outdoor adventuring spots. Large backyard with fire pit, a garden full of fresh fruits and veggies, and plenty of space for your four legged family members to romp around.
space: The location is great! Close to everything you could hope for. The neighborhood is very established with giant trees and great views. It's a peaceful and comfortable place to stay while visiting Oregon and all of her outdoor adventuring splendor. Spin some records, build a fire, play some board games, make some food, and go get some beer growlers filled at the local tap house just up the street!

notes: There may be another Airbnb guest in the mother-in-law suite on the lower level which has its own entrance and is separated from the main house by a locking door.
transit: Public transportation is minutes away and Salem also has Lyft!
access: You'll have access to the whole upper level which includes 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, a spacious living room, kitchen, patio, and a large shared backyard. Take advantage of the fire pit and grill and help yourselves to some garden fresh fruits and veggies.
interaction: If we are in town we will be downstairs which has its own entry and is separated by a locking door. The backyard is shared and if we're home during your stay our three dogs will be out there a couple times a day. They may bark at you at first, but they are all very friendly so feel free to say hi! We are available via message or phone if you have any questions or need anything during your stay.
house_rules: - Make yourselves at home, but please be respectful of our home, belongings, and neighbors.  - Please clean up after yourselves and try to leave the house in the same state as you found it. - Please be considerate of our neighbors in regard to noise volume and the time of day. - Please kennel pets when they are unattended (XL pen provided) - No smoking in the house. - Call or text us if you are uncertain about anything.

name: Paxson House - Giardino Room
summary: Step into the oasis of a welcoming room in our beautiful classic craftsman home in South Salem. Even though we're on a busy corner, we've created a sanctuary in the well appointed Italian-themed rooms. You have access to a comfy living room downstairs and our entire backyard, patio with grill and secluded garden & fountain. Giardino room is air conditioned, has free wi-fi access, internet TV, recliner, mini-fridge, bathrobes and Keurig for your enjoyment. Near great restaurants and wineries.

host_about:
Your hosts, Tim and Connie combine their artistic skills to create an atmosphere of welcoming and ambience of warmth and relaxation. Tim's love of photography and Connie's hospitality and catering background blend to make Paxson House a natural choice for travelers or that special occasion getaway. We feel that we are stewards of this classic home that "wrap its arms around you." Our trip to Italy inspired us to decorate with the themed old world charm. 
   Respecting the privacy of our guests, we set the stage, yet are available to answer questions or provide suggestions of local activities and/or venues.
   Tim and Connie love to explore new eateries and wineries, cycling, and travel. We also love to dance.  Connie and Tim are both writers. Connie is a stylist with an innovative clothing company.  Tim is a safety consultant. We have named our home "Paxson House for two reasons:  It is named after the original owner Glenn Paxson 2, who was the State of Oregon Bridge Engineer.  Also, Paxson can be translated "Son of Peace"  which we hope you sense when you step through the door.

Hello!  My name is Cynthia (Cindy as most call me) and the handsome man by my side is my husband Rob. If you decide to stay with us you will get to meet our three fur babies, they are Jake (the old man), Max (the foodie), and Oliver (the youngster). No worries we strive to keep our place fur lite! 
We decided to list our room because we were getting married and needed to save money for the big event! Well the big event is done and now on to paying off our honeymoon (soo worth it!). Youll find that our home is roomy and comfortable. It's nestled in a family community not far from I-5. Please don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions at all. Thank you so much for considering staying with us.

name: Sunnyslope Retreat  - Private Entry and Fireplace
summary: Enjoy the Willamette Valley Wine Country in this recently renovated one-bedroom apartment in quiet South Salem. Featuring  a private entrance, fireplace, Sleep Number bed and air conditioning.  Business ready, and close to Willamette, Corban and Western Oregon Universities, with shopping and restaurants nearby. Enjoy historic downtown Salem, wine tasting at local wineries, or write that next great novel while you sit by the fire. Sunnyslope Retreat awaits you!
space: Sunnyslope Retreat is a private apartment on the lower level of our home in the quiet South Salem Sunnyslope neighborhood, and is perfect for 1 or 2 people. The entrance is at the rear of the house, with access down the left-side driveway.  Newly renovated (summer 2017), the 685 sq. ft. apartment has a large living area with comfortable furniture, DISH satellite, 42" flat screen TV, Amazon Fire TV (access Netflix, Hulu, HBO, etc.), ceiling fans and new blackout window shades on the large picture window (this side of the house gets morning sun). We love the new wood plank ceiling and know our guests will enjoy the cozy gas fireplace. There is a kitchenette with a mini fridge/freezer, microwave, coffeepot, electric kettle, blender, toaster and slow cooker (no oven or stovetop). We provide for your convenience coffee, tea, cream and sugar, salt and pepper. Breakfast items include breakfast bars, yogurt, hot cereal packets and fresh fruit. You'll find dishes and other meal prep utensils. T
description: Enjoy the Willamette Valley Wine Country in this recently renovated one-bedroom apartment in quiet South Salem. Featuring  a private entrance, fireplace, Sleep Number bed and air conditioning.  Business ready, and close to Willamette, Corban and Western Oregon Universities, with shopping and restaurants nearby. Enjoy historic downtown Salem, wine tasting at local wineries, or write that next great novel while you sit by the fire. Sunnyslope Retreat awaits you! Sunnyslope Retreat is a private apartment on the lower level of our home in the quiet South Salem Sunnyslope neighborhood, and is perfect for 1 or 2 people. The entrance is at the rear of the house, with access down the left-side driveway.  Newly renovated (summer 2017), the 685 sq. ft. apartment has a large living area with comfortable furniture, DISH satellite, 42" flat screen TV, Amazon Fire TV (access Netflix, Hulu, HBO, etc.), ceiling fans and new blackout window shades on the large picture window (this side of the house get
neighborhood_overview: We are 10 minutes from I-5, off the Kuebler exit.  Close by, the Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from our home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery. Downtown Salem is a 10-minute drive and has much to offer in the way of restaurants, coffee shops and shopping.  Of special interest is Riverfront Park, whose two pedestrian bridges link it to West Salem and to Minto-Brown Island Park, which spreads out over 1,200 acres of lush, open and wooded areas. Willamette University is 4 miles away and just east of downtown. Corbin University is 6 miles to the east.  Salem is located in the verdant Willamette Valley, famous for its wineries and farms.  We are just over an hour from the coast and a couple hours from the mountains.
notes: We are a smoke-free, vape-free property, inside and outside of the suite. We do not allow pets. Please be mindful of our neighbors and your noise level if you are outside in the evenings. Please know that since this is the lower level of our home, you will hear noises you would expect to hear when people live above you, not unlike an apartment or a hotel room.  We will be as quiet as possible but you will hear sounds of life from upstairs.  (We are not party animals, don’t fight much, and like our music soft.)
transit: Uber and Lyft are available in Salem. Cherriots bus service is one block away.
access: Guests can enjoy a grassy lower-level back yard surrounded by trees. Street parking is preferred (the driveway is extremely narrow). There is a sitting area outside the entrance where you can read, sip your favorite drink and enjoy the squirrels (except winter months).
interaction: We are available by text message if you need anything, but we will respect your privacy.
house_rules: - No shoes in house - Quiet hours after 9 PM - Visitors other than registered guests must be approved by hosts - WiFi may be used only for legal purposes and you promise not to use it for illegal uploading, downloading, or other illegal activities. - The home is not suitable for guests with service animals. This is an owner-occupied property and due to alergies in the home, no animals are permitted.
host_about:
Chuck and Lorie met in a traveling theater company and have logged a lot of miles in their careers. Chuck continues to travel as a professional actor and storyteller. Lorie works as a legal secretary at a law firm in Salem. Travel is a part of their DNA and they often stay at Airbnbs. 

They have 3 sons, one daugher in-law and 2 grandchildren. Family is a priority and their home is filled with rich memories of raising their family in Salem.

name: WittsPad - Attic
summary: This is 1 of 2 rooms available to reserve inside this 1920's Craftsman House.  Please see my other listing "WittsPad" for details about the 2-person bedroom on the main floor. Located in the historical Edgewater District of West Salem, it is in convenient proximity to downtown Salem.  You are within walking/biking distance from local eateries, the river, Audubon, coffee shop, tap-house, bookstore, mini-free libraries & more!
space: Beginning at the top, this attic space offers a cozy studio-like atmosphere with a bookshelf dividing the bedroom area from the private living room. The sofa in the living room pulls out to sleep 2 more guests and is quite comfy with its memory-foam mattress topper. Equipped with a semi-portable heating/cooling unit, television, record player, bluetooth speakers, and game station. The bedroom on the main floor sleeps 2 and boasts plenty of natural light. This room is adjacent to the shared bathroom and the common-area living room. Doors have a latch lock from the inside.
description: This is 1 of 2 rooms available to reserve inside this 1920's Craftsman House.  Please see my other listing "WittsPad" for details about the 2-person bedroom on the main floor. Located in the historical Edgewater District of West Salem, it is in convenient proximity to downtown Salem.  You are within walking/biking distance from local eateries, the river, Audubon, coffee shop, tap-house, bookstore, mini-free libraries & more! This room is adjacent to the shared bathroom and the common-area living room. Doors have a latch lock from the i
neighborhood_overview: We are so close to a variety of options for recreation and enjoyment. If you enjoy reading, there are several mini-free libraries in our immediate neighborhood & throughout Salem. We have a stash of books available for you to use as your "swap" with any of the inventory in the mini's. Or, if you want to get lost in our local new/used bookstore, "Reader's Guide", it's only blocks away :) Also just 3 blocks away is a small but lovely Audobon Reserve where you can birdwatch, or, just stroll through and enjoy the nature trails. Enjoy biking? Bring your own distance bike, or, use one of our "everyday" bikes to explore the nearby Willamette Valley Scenic Bikeway. Walking/Running opportunities are just outside the door, when you jump on the greenway of Edgewater Park and head toward Riverfront Park, Wallace Marine Park, or, Minto Island Brown Park. There is a lovely walking bridge nearby to cross the Willamette River by foot or bike. And let's not forget that we are in wine country, here! Win
notes: This listing is for the room in the attic, which sleeps up to 4. If you are interested in the bedroom on the main floor, which sleeps 2, please adjust the filters of your search to "2 people" and book accordingly. Feel free to contact me with any questions prior to booking.
transit: Public bus stop is one block away. Amtrak train-depot is less than 3 miles away. We have some bikes available, for your enjoyment while staying with us, too!
access: The main floor of our Craftsman is the heart of the home, and we invite you to make yourself comfortable. Here you will find the kitchen, main living-room, dining room & library/game room. Just off of the library is the shared bathroom and the stairs leading up to the attic room. This floor is also where you access the outdoor areas, like the back porch, backyard, or bicycles for cruising the city. The basement is where laundry is done, if needed.
interaction: Whether you are here on business or pleasure, we will follow your lead on how much, or little, interaction you desire. We are definitely happy to provide you with local recommendations or answer any questions...just ask :) Breakfast on weekdays is a continental offering of quick bites (breads/pastries, fruit, etc.) During the weekends, you are invited to gather with us at the dining table to enjoy a hot morning meal together. Coffee Bar set up daily by 7:07am and includes creamer, sugar & Torani syrups. Loose leaf tea is also available. Coffee beans roasted fresh and delivered weekly by local coffee roaster, Steel Bridge Coffee. It's delightful! We do have pets, an 11 year old Golden Lab, a 1 year old Akbash, and a 4 year old cat; all are indoor/outdoor pets. Their entertaining antics are included with your fee ;)
house_rules: - 10pm quiet time :)
