name: Jefferson Garden Cottage
summary: Jefferson Garden Cottage in Salem, OR is owned by Carole Smith and hosted by Angela Jones. Why rent a hotel room when you can have an entire house to yourself for the same price! The Jefferson Garden Cottage is a beautiful newly renovated 3 bedroom house near downtown Salem. Enjoy this three story, comfortable, spotlessly clean and spacious house for each and every guest! It has two beautiful new bathrooms with full showers as well as a brand new fully stocked gourmet kitchen!
space: Come home to a tree lined street, quiet neighbors, and a newly refurbished house.  It can all be yours here in Salem.   We just finished a multi year renovation of this 1941 cottage.  Everything in the house was built with your comfort in mind.  Freshly finished antique oak floors, arched entryway, crystal doorknobs, etc.   Everything inside the house is new, clean and luxurious.   Are you tired of looking at other peoples nick-nacks all over their Airbnb house?  Not here! Everything is clean and pristine but homey and comfortable.   Enjoy a very quiet stay in the neighborhood close to downtown Salem, Salem Hospital, Willamette University and wineries in the West Salem Hills.  Day trips to the beach, Portland, Silver Creek Falls Park, State Fairgrounds, and mountain skiing are easy from this house. Relax by the fireplace in the living room or by the fireplace in the basement TV room.  Watch our new 60 inch 4000k high def TV. This is your home away from home.   Come cut fresh flowers ou

neighborhood_overview: This is an established neighborhood that is changing over and houses are being purchased and renovated.   This is a quiet neighborhood and the house has double pane windows for added quiet.
notes: You must be able to climb stairs. However, there is a bedroom, bathroom and kitchen on the main floor. You would just have to make it up a few steps to the outside door to get into the house. To access the other two bedrooms or the entertainment room you will have to go up or down a full flight of stairs.
transit: You are encouraged to park in the driveway. There are the Cherriots Transit center that is downtown that you can also use to get around.
access: Guests have the whole space to themselves during their stay. I only ask for you to treat this property with the same or more respect that you would treat your own! There is a closet in the basement entertainment room that will remain locked as the owner's closet.
interaction: All your interactions will be with my co host Angela Jones, she is a bright and energetic women who will answer any questions that you may have! Throughout your entire stay and coming up to your arrival date feel free to contact her with any questions or concerns.
house_rules: - The house is newly remodeled with high end furnishings, so please treat it as your own. - This is a neighborhood home which abides by the cities quiet hours of 10PM to 7AM - No animals allowed. No exceptions. Please park your car in our driveway and not on the street.
host_about:
While I went to college for Art, I started an art gallery and from there that morphed into a greeting card company we distributed throughout the US and Canada.  For 22 years we published greeting cards under the name "Carole Smith Gallery (art cards) and "One World, One Race".   While we published greeting cards we also renovate 4 large commerical historic buildings in downtown, and this house on Jefferson Street.   

My husband and I LOVE renoving historic buildings and breathing another 100 years of life into each building we touch.   Come see why we love these historic buildings.

name: Awesome new home in beautiful West Salem -
summary: Enjoy a quiet pristine home that's literally minutes to fantastic wineries of our infamous Willamette wine region. You'll  also be minutes to Salems quaint downtown and gorgeous parks for hiking, biking or leisurely walks.  Take advantage of thr great restaurants including of course unique beers and popular ciders of the region. Since Salem is the State Capitol- there are cool historic sites to see.  If you felt like a trip to the coast? It's a scenic 45 minute drive from West Salem.
space: This home was torn down and completely remodeled in the last couple years. I just purchased the home in July. Since I relocated here from Northern California , it was important to me to find a home with tons of light, space, and open floor plan. It has hardwood floors and all new appliances .The minute you walk in you'll see what I mean- clean, bright and lovely.  Large glass back doors to see manicured lawns, and nice back patio with table to enjoy coffee or a meal!  You'll also have internet access, Washer/Dryer and refrigerator if need be. Kitchen has all the newest appliances that's an extra added plus. Quiet neighborhood that's well manicured and very safe. You can literally fall asleep hearing crickets.

summary: Perfect for the single female professional in Salem on health care training rotations or government officials on business with the State of Oregon,  this cozy, single story townhome has big amenities for the discriminating person Steps from a 50 acre wetlands and running trails, tastefully furnished, soothing rooms and sunny deck and patio greet travelers who want to relax after touring Oregon wineries, hiking trails, or a quick day trip to the coast.
space: Your nature reserve is a serene setting for a get-away, yet close to public transportation. Breakfast supplied with coffee, tea, in-season fruits and berries, pastries, and organic juices and almond/coconut/flax milk for smoothies.

neighborhood_overview: Towering fir trees, expanses of green space and a wetlands provide soothing access to nature.  You'll enjoy strolling by the duck pond and jogging on paths that wind through wild space where you will hear bird calls and see the resident flocks of geese.
notes: Welcome to the City of Salem.  As in any hotel or motel, the City of Salem will collect a 9% Transient Occupancy Tax on all Airbnb stays. The Certificate of Authority to collect this tax is on display in the home.  Please make arrangements to pay the tax in cash.  Upon request, you can be mailed a copy of the receipt issued by the City of Salem.
transit: Close to bus service and I-5, minutes from downtown Salem, Willamette University, historic sites, hospital services, and fine dining.

name: Private Room in Comfort Home
summary: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines.  I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met.  This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone.  I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request.
space: Two rental rooms share a very large full bathroom with both tub and shower.  One room has a private half bathroom.  Guests share the grand room with living, dining and kitchen surrounding a three-sided gas fireplace.  Guest can use home gym, backyard with hot tub and barbecue.  The kitchen is designed for cooking and will share small amounts of condiments, spices and other items used for cooking.  My space is on opposite side of house, upstairs and private.   Self check-in is possible but I prefer to meet my guests to orient them to the home. Home has had a recent safety inspection and the only security webcam is upstairs in the owner's private section of the house.  Neighborhood is very safe, but do recommend you lock your car at night.  Good neighborhood watch that assures overall safety in this neighborhood.
description: Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines.  I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met.  This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone.  I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request. Two rental rooms share a very large full bathroom with both tub and shower.  One room has a private half bathroom. neighborhood_overview: Well established high end neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Located on a cul-de-sac with adequate parking and little traffic so it is very quiet.  Feels like a mountain resort due to the large and dense oak and pine trees.  Back yard opens into quiet and beautiful neighborhood park.   10 minutes from I-5 Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from my home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery.  4 miles from downtown Salem.  Blocks from gas station.

name: Wildlife Getaway!
summary: There is a railroad behind our home that passes once daily.  This adds charm to our space :)  We have noise makers available should you fear the train waking you in the night (this may or may not happen).  While we are located in a brand new neighborhood, our home backs up to a 1200 acre wild life reserve that has bike trails for miles & walking paths along the Willamette River.  From our deck you may enjoy a variety of birds and deer.  Downtown is 5 min away.
space: Guests have access to our entire home. We are located out a country road in a brand new, quiet, residential neighborhood. Our house backs up to a wildlife preserve that offers seclusion and a beautiful view. We are only 5-7 minutes from downtown. We have high-speed Internet. One thing that makes our home unique is that we offer free day passes to a co-working space located in the historic part of downtown Salem. This of course creates an opportunity for you to have a working space outside of our home along with the opportunity to network.

neighborhood_overview: We live in a brand new, quiet, residential neighborhood. Our house backs up to a railroad track and a 1200 acre wildlife reserve. The back of our house faces this wildlife reserve offering a beautiful view and seclusion off our back deck. Guess will have access to the wildlife reserve and can enjoy walking or biking on the many trails that run along the willamette river.
transit: We have several parking spaces in the driveway and along the street. We do have a bike or two that guests may use. You can actually walk all the way into downtown by foot if you prefer. Salem also has Uber and lift available.
access: Guests have access to our Entire home
interaction: We do not meet our guests in person and they will have the privacy of our home without any disruptions.  We are available by phone, text or email as needed. We have a reputation for being extremely responsive and are here to answer any questions that you may have during your stay.
host_about:
Friendly and warm, down to earth, family oriented and professional.

I enjoy traveling adventures, coffee with friends, reading and being in nature.

Our home has a peaceful and inviting feel.  We rent our entire home, lending privacy to our guests.  You will enjoy the charm of the nearby railway and the beauty from our large back deck that faces a wild life reserve.  You may see a few deer wander by and enjoy many birds from the back deck.  Please be aware that the train typically passes once daily and we are unable to predict the time of day it will pass.  We have noise makers available to our guests should you be concerned about the train passing at night and waking you up.

summary: Welcome. Need a place for a night or two or week or more? This may be right for you. I welcome people from the LGBQT community as well as people from other cultures. The house is located in a quiet, well-established neighborhood. host_about:
Welcome to my home.
I'm retired from working in a college setting with people with disabilities. While I am a relatively private person, I enjoy meeting new people and learning about their cultures and ideas. I love to read and take time out to spend at the beach with my friends and furry buddy.   My favorite thing is laughing!

In my twenties I hitchhiked all around the UK.  I have also lived in Japan for a year.
I'm a New England transplant but have been here in Oregon since 1980.

I look forward to meeting you and to helping make your visit to Salem a very pleasant and comfortable one!

name: Myrtle Cottage Guest House
summary: Myrtle Cottage is located on our 1/2 acre property with parking in front  of the guest house. Antique Queen bed, spacious sleeping area with cable TV and Wi-Fi. Small Kitchen with sink, microwave, small fridge, toaster oven. Bathroom has a claw foot bathtub with a shower.  Pleasant covered  porch with seating for two. No pets allowed, no smoking. We are 10 minutes from downtown Salem, close to Williamette University, Western Oregon University, Salem Hospital and  Williamette Valley Wineries.
space: Portland is about 60 miles north of Salem, Eugene is about 60 miles south and Lincoln City is about 50 miles to the Oregon coast. Bend area is about 120 miles east of Salem. Many wineries are located within 3 to 20 miles.

host_about:
We are active seniors, I belong to a book club, knitting club, exercise at a local gym 2-3 times a week, we play cards and Mexican Train dominoes with friends. 

I volunteer at Assistance League (Daue House) in Salem.

My Husband enjoys gardening, working on our landscape and cooking.

We enjoy vacationing in Kona, HI  and with family in Monterey and Carlsbad, CA. 

We live close to downtown Salem, Williamette University, Western Oregon University, Salem Hospital. We are about 3 miles from many Williamette Valley wineries.

Also you you would probably enjoy the Oregon Gardens in Silverton and Woodburn Outlets about 30 minutes from Salem. 

Motto: Do what you love!

summary: Beautiful 3 Bedroom 2 bath apartment in West Salem. Built in 2016, this home is only 2 miles from Downtown and walking distance to Safeway and a number of restaurants and coffee shops. Setting is in a wooded area on a side street. Your apartment is below our house. You have separate parking and entrance. You'll have access to our home theater during your stay.
space: This place is perfect for families, business travelers and small groups. The apt faces a wooded area and has a deck with access to the back yard. You can see the capital between the trees on clear days and city lights at night. Drink your coffee on the deck in the morning and listen the birds. You will feel like you are far away from the city but in reality minutes from downtown. Outside of your front door you'll have access to a shared theater room. With a 130" screen, apple tv, cable and game console, you'll be able to entertain and be entertained.

description: Welcome to the Sassy Sunflower Haus! You are invited to relax in our simple, but inviting home.  Minutes away from I-5 and easy to find. We're close to downtown and the Capitol as well! We love Salem and meeting new people of all backgrounds. LGBTQ and kid-friendly! The environment is important to us.  Join us as we do our best to compost and recycle.  Our electricity is green source renewable through PGE! Our home is relaxed, comfortable, and cozy.  Cute and trim with clean lines and super fun colors.  Tidy, but welcoming! While here, you are welcome to use the kitchen and all common areas, including the living room, covered back patio, and giant trampoline (great for kids!). Please note that there is no TV or microwave, and only a French press for coffee. Feel free to use the refrigerator and freezer. neighborhood_overview: The house is a pleasant 10-15 minute walk to Safeway, state offices, and the Capitol, located near North Salem high school. Very close to downtown and easy access from I-5 via Market St. Neighbors are friendly and we have a strong sense of community.
notes: The living room and kitchen have A/C, but the bedroom does not. There is generally a good breeze in the evening if you open the windows.

name: Historic 2BR Salem House w/Views of Mill Creek!
summary: Experience the pristine natural splendor of Oregon's Willamette Valley in style at the 'Daniel S. Yoder House,' a delightfully updated Salem vacation rental home. Located in a wonderful, friendly neighborhood within walking distance of the State Capitol and downtown Salem, the home sits right along the serene Mill Creek and displays a graceful blend of historic beauty and modern comfort, providing the perfect setting for your tranquil getaway to the Pacific Northwest!
space: Featuring 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and enough room to comfortably sleep 6 guests throughout 1,600 square feet of fashionably appointed living space, this stunning house is an ideal lodging choice for families or friends out for a relaxing Oregon retreat. As soon as you arrive, you'll immediately fall in love with the picturesque nature of this quiet neighborhood, complimented by a magnificent scene of the sun peeking through large trees, casting beautiful shadows over this inviting property. Originally constructed in 1898, the 'Daniel S. Yoder House' is on the National Registry of Historic Homes and has been tastefully renovated to have an urban loft feel while still keeping historical touches. You'll find yourself enchanted by the home's 19th-century architecture, gorgeous wood furnishings and splashes of handsome red brick accents, coupled with hints of contemporary convenience to create a seamless fusion of old-world sophistication and modern elegance. Every amenity you need to feel

neighborhood_overview: Although the house is nestled in a quaint historic neighborhood, you won't have to venture far to access the region's most notable attractions and entertainment options! Take a short stroll into downtown Salem to visit the State Capitol, or to try out different dining establishments with local cuisine. Historic Elsinore Theatre is located nearby in downtown as well and often has productions available for your viewing pleasure. Located in the heart of Willamette Valley, this property offers easy access to over 50 wineries within a 30-mile radius, along with an endless variety of attractions such as museums, universities, and other awesome Oregon towns. You'll also find extensive parks and wildlife areas within just a few miles of the home, making it a perfect central location for your outdoor recreational needs. Embark on a quick 1-hour drive for an enthralling day trip to the coast to enjoy the wonderful beaches. On your way home, be sure to stop in town for delicious dining, delectabl
notes: Key Residence Features:  - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, central heating and air conditioning, beautiful outdoor dining area, large private enclosed yard, flat screen smart TV with streaming capabilities, in-unit washer/dryer, wireless internet access, and much more - The home's coffee maker is a Keurig 2.0 brewing system, which lets you brew a single cup and a carafe - bring your favorite K-cups or feel free to use the ones provided! - Terrific location in a friendly, quiet neighborhood with easy access to dining, shopping, museums, parks, theatres and other attractions!  - Peaceful, private setting along Mill Creek. Perfect for entertaining or just getting away! - Secure storage for sports equipment. Guest can bring their mountain bikes, camping equipment, skis and even a canoe and know there is a clean secure storage area available (no additional cost) - Off-street parking available for 2 cars (Garage parking available upon request for compact or sub compact vehicles o
interaction: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is on a mission to make vacation rental easy for guests. Every property in our network has been vetted and verified so you can book with confidence. If you have questions prior to your trip, we are happy to assist you 7 days a week. During your stay, your designated Guest Contact will be available 24/7 to help with any issues that may arise.

Hi, we’re Evolve! We’re a next-generation vacation rental management company and we’re here to help you find the perfect home for your getaway.

All of our properties adhere to our 4 Core Property Standards, so you’ll always arrive to a home that’s Safe, Clean, Guest Ready and As Advertised.

neighborhood_overview: Located approximately 2 Miles from downtown shopping, dining and the Capital building. Several tripadvisor rated parks are within 5-10 minutes such as the Salem Riverfront Park , Minto-Brown Island State Park, and Bush Pasture Park.  Located about an hour from Oregon's coast, 1 hour to Portland,  40 minutes from Spirit Mountain Casino, 30 minutes to the Woodburn premium outlets, 2 hours to Mt. Hood State Park, 40 minutes to Silver Creek Falls. About 10 minutes from Willamette University, 15 minutes from Chemeketa Community College and 20 minutes from Western Oregon University.  There are also many wineries within 15 -30 minutes depending on which way you're headed.  Minutes from Starbucks and Dutch Brothers Coffee.
notes: This home has a shared wall so please keep the noise to a minimum after 9PM as a courtesy to the neighbors.
transit: We are located in West Salem across the Willamette River and on weekdays during commute hours there is traffic going into Salem, in the morning and returning to West Salem in the evening, but at other hours of the day there is little to no traffic. If you plan on visiting Salem without a vehicle, we are located approximately 20 minute walk from Glen Creek Rd Cherriots Bus Transfer Center.  If you plan on using bus service and would like a closer bus station, you can schedule a pickup 5 minutes away via the West Salem Connector.  The West Salem Connector runs from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. Riders book trips at (URL HIDDEN) or by cal(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).   It's best to book in advance according to their website. 10 Minutes from Greyhound, Enterprise rent a car and Amtrak station.  In addition, guests can use Uber or Lyft to get around town.
access: The home in its entirety is available for guest access with the exception of the garage and master closet.
interaction: Our home has coded entry locks so we will generally send you all the information for your stay and let you check in yourselves.  There will be a guest guidebook with more information for your stay and if you have any issues we will be in the area able to help you.
house_rules: - As the home has a shared wall, please be mindful of excessive noise after 9PM. - Please put all dishes in the dishwasher. Leave all used linens and towels on the beds or floor so we know they need washed. Guests may wear shoes in the home, we just ask that you remove them if they are dirty from a hike, rain or other activities.

name: Nice cozy and quiet room in SE Salem
summary: Tired of noisy - and perhaps not so clean - motel rooms? Then our thoroughly cleaned private room is just what your looking for! Our single family house is located in a quiet cul-de-sac in SE Salem. It is just 5 minutes to I-5 or Highway 22 and only a short drive to Bush Park or Mento-Brown Park if you enjoy walking. It's also only around eight minutes to downtown Salem for some entertainment (such as shows at the Grand Theatre) or to visit the capitol. Our location offers MANY possibilities!
space: Perfect room if you enjoy a quiet place to read your favorite book or work on your laptop. Small closet with some basic clothes hangers, a queen-size bed, end table, bookshelf, microwave and mini-fridge. You can use the washer/dryer for a small cost. High speed WiFi. All sheets, blankets, towels are sanitized and fragrance-free.

host_about:
VERY IMPORTANT PLEASE READ: 

We are early to bed early to rise people so to speak, so if you want to reserve a stay, please send your request as soon and as early in the day as possible. Any request to stay sent to us after 10 pm our time WILL MOST LIKELY NOT BE SEEN, CONFIRMED AND/OR RESPONDED TO UNTIL 7 OR 8 AM THE NEXT DAY WHEN WE RISE. 

Having said that, here's a bit about us.

Steve and I enjoy bird watching and going on walks by the river. We both love to listen to blues and swing music and watch movies through Netflix and Amazon. Occasionally we take trips to the coast, especially on hot days.

host_about:
I am a retired medical transcriptionist. I was the first server in our craft brewery back in 2012 and loved serving people. Previously, I have been a housekeeper for two 5-star hotels. A long time ago I was an art student in Brooklyn. We moved a lot when I was a child because my father was in the Navy during WW2.

Ian is from England. We met 30 years ago when he was working in a quaint hostel in Ashland; a place known for its Shakespeare festival. I was a guest. He lived under the stairs just like Harry Potter. He is the head brewer in the craft brewery we’re partners in.

name: Heart of Downtown Living-TRY LIVING DOWNTOWN!
summary: Right in the middle of downtown Salem (369 Court St NE)I have found yet another beautiful loft to share with whomever wants to come visit our wonderful city! The Heart of Downtown Living Apartment is a 900 sq ft two bedroom, single bath that has a fully stocked roomy kitchen; as well as a great view. Come stay with us and be close to so many attractions Salem has to offer, from the Riverfront park, Salem Center Mall, to Wine tasting and hikes just a short drive in surrounding areas.
space: This is a unique experience to live in the center of downtown, walking distance to over 40 restaurants, shop at local independent stores, Kohls, Penneys - all 1-2 blocks away.   Just 3 blocks to Willamette University and the Oregon State Capitol building and othere state agencies.

You are in the heart of Willamette Valley's wine industry, brew pubs, great coffee shops, and restuarants.   Your apartment is located between Starbucks Coffee and Great Harvest Baking.
notes: You must be able to climb stairs - this apartment is upstairs.  This is a quiet part of downtown and we just installed double pane windows to cut down more sound and for climate control.  The apartment has heating, electric fireplace and air conditioning for your use. Salem License #(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)-LI
transit: Main bus station is 1 1/2 blocks from the apartment.   You can walk almost anywhere from the apartment.  Major public parking garage just down the alley.  3 hours free parking on the steet during the day, and free all night parking.

host_about:
While I went to college for Art, I started an art gallery and from there that morphed into a greeting card company we distributed throughout the US and Canada.  For 22 years we published greeting cards under the name "Carole Smith Gallery (art cards) and "One World, One Race".   While we published greeting cards we also renovate 4 large commerical historic buildings in downtown, and this house on Jefferson Street.   

My husband and I LOVE renoving historic buildings and breathing another 100 years of life into each building we touch.   Come see why we love these historic buildings.

name: Private room at "Oak Abode"
summary: Private bedroom with private half-bath in our warmly furnished home. Located on a quiet, safe street in West Salem. We're on a hill with expansive views. Close to downtown and river front parks. Enjoy the large deck for coffee, a glass of wine in the evening (weather permitting), or just hanging out.  A new walk-in shower in the main bathroom is shared (robes provided).  We'll provide a continental breakfast, but the kitchen is not available for cooking.
space: We love our home which we have named "Oak Abode" for the towering Oregon White Oak and that generously shades us in summer.   The guest room with a private, adjoining half- bath is newly remodeled and furnished, including a new queen mattress with memory foam topper.  Our neighborhood is quiet and safe with friendly neighbors all around.  The large deck has territorial views including the Cascades and Mt. Jefferson.

access: You’ll have an off-street parking place of your own (next to our cars). Access to our home is through the front door and your room is immediately next to the entrance.  You are welcome to enjoy the deck and living room, where your continental breakfast is served.  The kitchen is not for guest use, though small items may be placed in the refrigerator.
interaction: We enjoy meeting guests and recall all the  wonderful people we have met and shared time with while traveling with Airbnb.  We may share tea or a glass of wine on the deck, and at the same time, we are very respectful of our guest’s desire for privacy.  We want to be sure you have what you need to be comfortable and we are happy to point you toward good restaurants, walks, shops and interesting things to do.
house_rules: Quiet hours from 10pm to 7am. Kitchen use is not available, however, small items may be stored in the refrigerator.
host_about: We are happily and recently married, finding each other later in life has been such a joy!  We love to travel and camp.  Jacqueline is retired from work in the natural personal care products, and previously as a women's clothing boutique owner.  Tom is retired from business management.  We enjoy our routines including morning yoga, long walks, a glass of wine with dinner, and evenings with Netflix (in winter).   Jacqueline loves to cook and Tom loves doing “projects” around the house.  Our home is an expression of our joint creativity and desire for beauty and comfort.  We love the people we meet while traveling with ABNB and in hosting ABNB guests.

name: Historic  Bungalow -King’s Room
summary: 1923 Bungalow located in Central Salem. Short drive to Capitol Building, museums, galleries, premier restaurants, and boutiques.  Silver Falls, home of 10 waterfalls, is nearby.  Visit the State Hospital site of the filming One Flew Over the Coocoo’s Nest and tour the museum.  Take a ride on a riverboat, or ride a handcrafted wooden carousel horse at River Front Park.  Scenic 60-minute drive to Portland.
space: King size bed, in room coffee station, light airy room, all the comforts of home. Home owner cares about sustainability and green living.

house_rules: - Please remove your shoes while in the house.   -Quiet hours after 10 pm.  You may come to the house later, just be mindful to not watch the tv or play music loudly.  -There is a compost pail on the kitchen counter for the coffee grains and recycle bins are provided, using them is greatly appreciated. Once you open the kitchen door, the recycle bins are located to the left of the stairs. -Please only use the plates, cups and silverware provided in the coffee/tea station.     -Please leave the tub, free of hair, and the bathroom clean after use.  -Please hand wash the dishes/silverware after use and place to dry in the dishwasher.   -Feel free to use the cookware in the kitchen, except the cast iron skillets.    -Please store food in the refrigerator, provided in the room.   -Please don't eat the food in the main refrigerator.    -Please store toiletries and towels/wash cloths in the Airbnb room and not in the restroom.    -No other guests except for those authorized through Airbnb.
host_about: I’m a Floridian who is residing in Salem, OR. Traveling, cooking, hiking, outdoor cycling, photography and whiskey tasting are a few of my hobbies. Meeting people of different walks of life has made for great conversations. My goal as a host is to make people welcomed in my home, whether I’m physically present or not.

name: Country Charm Near Downtown | Private Yard
summary: Rosemary Garden is a cozy remodeled 1948 cottage in Salem, Oregon, perfect for traveling professionals, couples, and families with older children. We also welcome longer-term guests (1-4 months).  If you need a quiet and comfortable place to work from home or to relax after a busy day, we welcome you!
space: Rosemary Garden feels cozy and intimate, yet is spacious and full of light. In summer, the private enclosed backyard will beckon you to relax and become enveloped in the intoxicating fragrance of jasmine. Snip fresh herbs from the garden year-round and enjoy fresh blueberries in July and Italian plums in September. LOCATION Nestled on the end of a quiet residential street with no through traffic, Rosemary Garden is centrally located. By car, it’s super close to Willamette University (1.4 miles), Salem Hospital (1.7 miles), the State Capitol (1.3 miles), downtown Salem (1.6 miles), the State Fairgrounds (1.8 miles), and many parks. It's also easy access to shopping and restaurants. Bus stops are nearby. Walk two blocks and you’ll find a small park with paved paths and large old trees, perfect for strolling or biking. neighborhood_overview: Downtown Salem offers a variety of charming, locally owned eateries. Head the other direction to Lancaster Drive and you’ll find familiar chain restaurants plus Mexican and Asian fare. Grocery stores are close by, and discount stores plus a small mall are all within a 10-minute drive.
notes: PARKING: The driveway can accommodate two cars and there is free parking in the street for one additional car.    NEIGHBORHOOD DOGS: Be aware that neighborhood dogs are sometimes allowed off-leash when the owners are outside. KEY: The key only opens the front and side doors of the house.  PORCELAIN SINK: The kitchen sink is porcelain so take care with glass, which can shatter if banged or dropped in the sink. (We understand accidents happen so please inform us. Our cleaning team will need to know.) KEEP KITCHEN CLEAN: Dirty dishes or open food left on the counter may attract tiny harmless ants. Please rinse dishes and load them in the dishwasher as soon as possible. FOOD: We will discard any open condiments or used food after you check out, so please buy in small quantities. We provide single serving packets of basic condiments. RECYCLE: Please help us recycle. Instructions are in the House Manual. LAWN SERVICE AND GARBAGE: You may see and hear the lawn service on Tuesday afternoons.
transit: Bus stops are just a 4-minute walk. Buses go directly downtown to Salem’s main bus depot. Uber and Lyft are also available if you need a taxi. If you’re driving, you’ll have quick, easy access to Interstate 5 (I-5) (2 miles from the house).  If you want to explore the region, the coast is just an hour directly west. The city of Portland with its famous International Rose Garden and the Columbia Gorge with its many waterfalls are both an hour north. Mt. Hood and Mt. St. Helens are further but worth the drive. Wineries dot the area and in the spring you can visit many flower gardens (iris, dahlia, peony, rose, tulip). Willamette Valley is also known for its U-Pick berry farms. From June to Labor Day, the Salem Volcanoes’ professional baseball team (single-A) play their home games just 15 minutes north on I-5. Check out the visitor's guide provided for you in the house for more activities.
access: The entire house is available except the garage and one locked room in the basement.
interaction: Our co-hosts live nearby and are caring for the house if you have any urgent needs. If issues or questions arise during your stay please notify them immediately so that that the problem can be addressed as soon as possible.
house_rules: AirBNB requires that guests read and agree to the House Rules before making a reservation. We want you to have a stress-free stay in our home so we feel it’s important that we share our expectations up front so there will be no misunderstandings.  Keep in mind our home is not a hotel nor is it owned by AirBNB; this is our private home containing our personal possessions. Thank you for taking time to read all the rules. A copy of the House Rules will be sent to you again before you book.  CITY TAX:  You will see an automatic charge on your reservation for taxes. This includes a 9% City of Salem Occupancy Tax plus a 1.8% State of Oregon Lodging Tax. 30+ DAYS LEASE: If you are staying for more than 30 days, we require that you sign a formal rental agreement. However you won't need to pay the 9% City of Salem Occupancy Tax. 30+ DAYS CLEANING: Bi-weekly cleaning is included in the cost. You are required to allow the housekeeper access to the house on those days. GUESTS:  All overnight guest
host_about: Both of us grew up on the East Coast, yet now we’re enthusiastic Oregonians. We savor the beauty here and enjoy all the things related to nature that Oregon has to offer—mountains, waterfalls, forests, desert, and the coast. David is always ready for a walk in the woods, and Shari will putter in her vegetable garden for hours (and joyfully eat what she grows). We’re quiet people with a love of simplicity. A relaxing evening may include reading non-fiction, listening to classical music, trying a new recipe, or going for a long walk. (Fun Fact: After 19 years of marriage without a TV in the house, we were finally pulled into the 21st century and bought one for Rosemary Garden. Enjoy!) Our jobs have included career counseling, graphic design, public speaking on health and career topics, helping refugees learn English, and nonprofit management. We’ve traveled to a number of different countries and enjoy learning about other cultures. Our many positive experiences staying in private AirBNB homes during our travels have helped us consider what you may need as our guest. Most likely we won’t get to meet you in person, but we welcome you as a friend and fellow traveler.

name: Large Salem Townhome Close to Wineries & Parks!
summary: Experience the beauty and serenity of the Pacific Northwest from the comfort of 'Salem's R&R Home,' a 3-bedroom, 1.5-bath vacation rental townhome in Southeast Salem. Not only does this 1,425-square-foot home's elegant decor create a remarkably cozy ambiance, its proximity to the area's hottest attractions makes it truly one-of-a-kind. After days spent touring wineries, exploring parks, and perusing markets, you'll look forward to watching the sunset from the comfort of your manicured backyard.
space: Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: 2 Twin Beds  As you lounge in the living room, you'll be overwhelmed by the calming effect the room has on you. Boasting a plush couch, flat-screen satellite TV, and large windows, the room will truly feel like a private sanctuary.  When stomachs start to rumble, head into the fully equipped kitchen and whip up a delicious dinner. As your friends feast at the dining table for 6, they're sure to be impressed by the 5-star fare you prepared on the expansive countertops.  Can't get enough of the mild Oregon weather? Move your meal to the furnished patio. As you wine and dine at the outdoor dining table, you'll be surrounded by the fenced-in yard's exquisitely-manicured landscaping.  No matter which bedroom you choose to retire to, sleep is sure to come easy atop the cozy beds, leaving you well-rested and ready for a day of adventures.  In the morning, take a relaxing soak in the bathroom's shower/tub combo, grab some clothes out

neighborhood_overview: Boasting old-time charm, beautiful seasonal scenery, and several flowing waterways, Salem has something for everyone! Head 6 minutes down the road to Riverfront City Park and embrace the fun family atmosphere. Home to a handmade carousel, a footbridge, and more, this 23-acre park is both fun and beautiful.  Channel your inner sommelier by touring some of Willamette Valley's acclaimed wineries, or enjoy all the excitement surrounding Bush's Pasture Park, the location of the Salem Art Festival and Soap Box Derby. Alternatively, Oregon State Fairgrounds, a 185-acre venue, is home to many annual events, concerts, and other entertainment.  Enjoy the warm weather by exploring the top-notch outdoor markets that sit less than a mile from the property. Operating between Spring and Fall, these markets offer arts, crafts, and fresh local produce for incredibly low prices.  Don't feel like cooking? Take a quick walk to Word of Mouth Bistro, named Salem's restaurants of the year twice, and feast on
notes: Key Residence Features: - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, flat-screen TV with Dish Network, furnished patio, fenced-in yard, free WiFi, open street parking, and more!  - Unbeatable Salem Location - Within 1 mile of delicious dining, 6 minutes from Riverfront City Park, minutes from several wineries, and a short walk from outdoor markets! - Nearest Commercial Airport: Portland International Airport (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) NE Airport Way, Portland, OR (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) miles away)
interaction: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is on a mission to make vacation rental easy for guests. Every property in our network has been vetted and verified so you can book with confidence. If you have questions prior to your trip, we are happy to assist you 7 days a week. During your stay, your designated Guest Contact will be available 24/7 to help with any issues that may arise.

Hi, we’re Evolve! We’re a next-generation vacation rental management company and we’re here to help you find the perfect home for your getaway.

All of our properties adhere to our 4 Core Property Standards, so you’ll always arrive to a home that’s Safe, Clean, Guest Ready and As Advertised.

If you have any questions about our properties (or would like help finding one), please do reach out. We’re real human beings and we’re available to assist you 7 days a week!

name: Century House Maple Suite
summary: This setting offers two bedrooms, a large completely refurbished master bath, a well-furnished kitchenette, and two common areas for eating, playing, working, reading, etc. Includes large queen room with lots of light, table/chairs, rocker, desk, and its own heating/cooling; and  and quiet corner room with double bed, easy chair, desk. Outside are dozens of shady places to relax, even in the rain. One mile or less to many attractions, restaurants, bike/walk trails, etc.
space: Enjoy a large collection of handmade quilts, and a large collection of adventure stories related to bicycling and mountain climbing.  Also, find numerous amenities for young children.  Television is NOT one of them :-).
description: This setting offers two bedrooms, a large completely refurbished master bath, a well-furnished kitchenette, and two common areas for eating, playing, working, reading, etc. Includes large queen room with lots of light, table/chairs, rocker, desk, and its own heating/cooling; and  and quiet corner room with double bed, easy chair, desk. Outside are dozens of shady places to relax, even in the rain. One mile or less to many attractions, restaurants, bike/walk trails, etc. Enjoy a large collection of handmade quilts, and a large collection of adventure stories related to bicycling and mountain climbing.  Also, find numerous amenities for young children.  Television is NOT one of them :-). Bicycles available for guests to enjoy, on a donation basis.
notes: Bicycles available for guests to enjoy, on a donation basis.
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

I am also available to pick you up from the train station as my schedule allows, just let me know at the time of booking.

house_rules: - Non-Smokers Only. Please acknowledge that you are non-smoker in your first communication with us. - Bringing your baby along? No problem! We can accommodate three adult guests plus one baby. We have a baby crib we could bring down from attic at no extra charge. - Absolutely no smoking allowed anywhere on the property, not even in the yard. We decline smokers because the stench of tobacco smoke permeates clothing and would end up in our home, so if you are a smoker, please look for some other place. Please acknowledge that you are non-smoker in your first communication with us. - No illegal drug use allowed. No loud parties allowed. Peace and quite is the theme here. - It is OK to arrive after check-in window due to late flight or other circumstances beyond your control. Just let us know.
host_about: Hi. My name is David. My wife is Michele. We have four cats. We live in Salem Oregon. I work for the state processing infrastructure and water system contracts. My passion is metrication. I try to convince Americans to get rid of silly Fahrenheit and inches and miles and gallons et cetera and embrace the International System. My favorite travel destination is France. I love Europe. I like spicy food. I love the music of Beethoven and Chopin. The people I admire the most are Sam Harris (American author, philosopher and neuroscientist) and Bill Maher (American comedian and political commentator). I always watch the Daily Show with Trevor Noah. My wife Michele loves Stephen King books and movies and John Oliver (English comedian and political commentator) and Bill Maher. Michele and I visited Iceland in April 2016 and we really love Iceland.

name: Charming Home w/ Yard - 5 Mins to Downtown Salem!
summary: Experience all the capital of Oregon has to offer from this spacious vacation rental home minutes from downtown Salem. This early 1900s house channels an endearing vintage feel while also providing the modern furnishings you need to feel right at home. With 3 bedrooms and 2 baths, 9 guests can also enjoy the upstairs entertainment area and expansive yard complete with a deck and fire pit. After venturing through Salem's many parks, gardens, and art museums unwind in the lovely living room!
space: Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3 (Loft): Queen Bed, Queen Sleeper Sofa, Twin Pullout  This roomy house will allow you to spread out and enjoy the peacefulness of vacation as well as spend quality time with your loved ones. Gather around in the delightful living area with modern furniture, tasteful decor, and a cozy fireplace. You'll also find a full, home office setup with a desk, laptop, and printer - perfect for planning the day's activities or getting any last-minute work done. On relaxing afternoons and warm evenings, the backyard offers a large, private space to lounge outdoors. When the sun goes down, circle up around the fire pit and share stories from the day while stargazing or roasting marshmallows! In the morning, get any last-minute work done or plan the day's itinerary in the office, with a desk, laptop, and printer available for your use. The loft entertainment room is equipped with a 55" flat-screen cable Smart TV. Curl up on the comfy couch to

Gather around in the delightful living area with modern furniture, tasteful decor, and a cozy fireplace. You'll also find a full, home office setup with a desk, laptop, and printer - perfect for planning the day's activities or getting any last-minute wor
neighborhood_overview: You'll be situated in the prime spot for all of your holiday plans in Salem while staying at this vacation rental house. Situated just 10 blocks north of downtown, reach all of Salem's popular attractions in less than a 10-minute drive or 30-minute walk.  Pay a visit to the Oregon State Capitol, a building that will enthrall both lovers of architecture and history buffs. The city also houses a variety of beautiful gardens and parks worth exploring, including Riverfront City Park, Bush's Pasture Park, Minto-Brown Island Park, and Deepwood Museum & Gardens.  If you're traveling with children, drive 11 miles to Enchanted Forest, a historic theme park with rides and fairytale-inspired attractions.  The property is located just across the street from the Oregon State Fair & Exposition Center. Experience the extraordinary Oregon State Fair if you're lucky enough to be traveling during the end of summer, but don't worry if not - the 185-acre space offers plenty of other fun rotating activitie
notes: Key Residence Features: - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, basic essentials, instant pot, full spice rack, a private entrance, smoke detector, carbon monoxide detector, portable AC, an office with a laptop and printer, free WiFi, central heating, ceiling fans, in-unit washer and dryer, 55" flat-screen cable Smart TV, fireplace, home office setup with a desk, laptop, and printer, spacious deck and yard, fire pit with outdoor seating, charcoal grill, first aid kids, a fire extinguisher, and more  - Long-term bookings now accepted! - Book a 5-night stay and receive a 10% discount or stay for a month at a 15% discounted rate! - Ideal Salem location situated across the street from the Oregon State Fair & Exposition Center, 10 blocks north of downtown, and within driving or walking distance of countless Salem attractions  - Nearest Commercial Airport: Portland International Airport (~58 miles away)
interaction: Evolve Vacation Rental Network is on a mission to make vacation rental easy for guests. Every property in our network has been vetted and verified so you can book with confidence. If you have questions prior to your trip, we are happy to assist you 7 days a week. During your stay, your designated Guest Contact will be available 24/7 to help with any issues that may arise.
house_rules: Policies: - No smoking - Pets allowed with $25/stay fee (35-pound weight limit) - No events, parties or large gatherings - Must be at least 25 years old to book - Additional fees and taxes may apply - NOTE: The steps to the bed in the loft are steep, and the 2nd bathroom is located in the basement - $20 per person, per night extra person fee (beyond 5 guests, max 9 guests allowed)  - Violation of the maximum occupancy or failure to pay the extra persons fee will result in an extra fine - The maximum occupancy is 6 adults and 3 children - NOTE: This property features two exterior cameras. One is located near the front door and the other by the garage - Photo ID may be required upon check-in
host_about:
Hi, we’re Evolve! We’re a next-generation vacation rental management company and we’re here to help you find the perfect home for your getaway.

All of our properties adhere to our 4 Core Property Standards, so you’ll always arrive to a home that’s Safe, Clean, Guest Ready and As Advertised.

If you have any questions about our properties (or would like help finding one), please do reach out. We’re real human beings and we’re available to assist you 7 days a week!

I hope to be able to be your host and to help your stay here in Salem be a wonderful experience.

name: Nana’s Tropical Boudoir
summary: Hi there! Welcome to Salem! We’ve got a home away from home ready for you. There is a local Salem brewery (Mcmenamins) with food a 5 minute walk down the street. We are close to shopping and buses. It’s about a 10 minute drive to downtown or to I5. We’re a couple in our early 30’s. We enjoy good food and drink, playing games, drinking Oregon beer, taking our dogs out and about, gardening, and being overall nerdy and crafty.  We have 2 dogs living here also, Luna and Maia.
space: You’ll have a bedroom and bathroom on the East end of the house. We stay on the far West end so you’ll definitely have your privacy! The house is easy to find and there is plenty of parking. The bed is comfy and warm, mattress is new, and more on the firm side. The guest bathroom is adjacent to your bedroom which is really convenient. We don’t have a TV- we stream.  We are flexible hosts and have travelled using Airbnb ourselves quite a bit. We totally get that sometimes you want to crash and get some alone time & sometimes you want to interact while traveling. Whatever you need, we’re here for!

neighborhood_overview: Close to a brewery, grocery store and tons of shopping/ restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk. We are 5 mins from a bus stop and our neighborhood is Uber friendly. Our street is a busier street, but once you’re in the house you don’t hear the sounds of the road much. Our home and neighborhood are quiet.
notes: Our dogs will probably bark at you when you walk through the door- they do the same to us. They love people, they’re just friendly and vocal!
transit: I’d definitely recommend Uber to get around, it’s fast and inexpensive.
access: You are free and welcome to use your room, bathroom, and the living/dining/kitchen and covered back patio!  There is breakfast for you, plenty of fridge/freezer space, and a washer/dryer if you need it. We have beer on tap in the garage which you are welcome to.  We are usually quieting down and watching tv by 9pm and up around 5am during the week, 6/7am on the weekends. We won’t be bothered at all of you stay up later- our bedroom is on the far end of the house!
interaction: We are here when you need us! I work from home upstairs in the office so I’m in my own world all day but easily just a text away. If we’re cooking or playing games, you’re more than welcome to join in!
host_about:
Hello Airbnb friends!

My husband and I plus our two dogs are lucky to call Salem OR our home! We’re both in our early thirties and are generally laid back people. We have enjoyed both traveling and hosting on Airbnb as we’ve met so many great people. You can probably find us out with our dogs, at a local brewery, or thrifting for treasures here in town!

name: Private bedroom/bathroom in a gated community!
summary: Spacious one bedroom and private full bath located in a beautiful gated community.  Apartment amenities: free washer/dryer, assigned parking, and balcony. Community amenities: playground, dog park, 24-hour gym, and pool. Close to grocery shopping and mall.  Perfect location for those looking to be minutes away from downtown Salem, a short drive to Portland, but want to stay in a private residential area. **Due to severe smoke-related allergies; we cannot accommodate any smokers of any kind.
space: **Due to severe smoke-related allergies; we cannot accommodate any smokers of any kind. We will have to charge a $200 deep cleaning fee and cancel the rest of your stay for any violations to this policy.  You will have your own bedroom with a writing desk and a walk-in closet. You will also have access to a private bathroom and full access to the balcony with a wood-fire grill. This is a great place to enjoy an early morning coffee or sun-bathe in the afternoon.  We have one mini English Bulldog sweetheart who lives with us. She is certified as an emotional support animal and will never be left home alone.  Additional sleeping space is available on the sofa bed if needed.  Full kitchen is provided for guests who want to make and store meals. We also provide take out menus for delivery convenience.

name: Beautiful Suite Near Downtown and Bush Park
summary: Fully remodeled guest apartment within walking distance of downtown Salem, Salem hospital, and Willamette University and Bush Park. Located in the beautiful, historic Bush Park neighborhood, this one bedroom space offers the perfect place to kick up your feet and relax. Full kitchen with dishwasher,  stove, and room to comfortably accomodate four people.  We use AirBnb to travel all the time and we built this specifically to be a place that we personally would want to stay.
space: The unit is 500 sq feet and located in the basement of our 1930's home. You will enter through a back entrance and go down a flight of stairs through a laundry room (the only shared space). Your private apartment door is located at the bottom of the stairs.  Kitchen features full fridge/freezer, stove, dishwasher and all the cooking utensils you will need. The space is large enough to comfortably seat 4 adults.   It is an open plan layout with the kitchen/dining/living area sharing the majority of the space. The couch easily converts to a queen sized bed. There is an electric fireplace that provides great ambiance and as much extra heat as you would like. The couch also has a storage area that holds extra blankets. In the summer this area stays very comfortable regardless of how hot it is outside. A portable fan is also provided.     The TV is internet only connected. We provide guests use of Netflix and Prime TV. An HDMI cable is also provided if you'd like to connect it to your lapto
description: Fully remodeled guest apartment within walking distance of downtown Salem, Salem hospital, and Willamette University and Bush Park. Located in the beautiful, historic Bush Park neighborhood, this one bedroom space offers the perfect place to kick up your feet and relax. Full kitchen with dishwasher,  stove, and room to comfortably accomodate four people.  We use AirBnb to travel all the time and we built this specifically to be a place that we personally would want to stay. The unit is 500 sq feet and located in the basement of our 1930's home. You will enter through a back entrance and go down a flight of stairs through a laundry room (the only shared space). Your private apartment door is located at the bottom of the stairs.  Kitchen features full fridge/freezer, stove, dishwasher and all the cooking utensils you will need. The space is large enough to comfortably seat 4 adults.   It is an open plan layout with the kitchen/dining/living area sharing the majority of the space. The cou
neighborhood_overview: The Bush Park neighborhood is our favorite neighborhood in Salem. It is full of craftsman homes and other early 1920's-30's architecture. It is a nice walking neighborhood. Bush Park is located just 2 blocks away and has beautiful walking trails, playgrounds, and picnic areas.
notes: Smoking: We do not allow smoking of any kind on the property, this includes the use of marijuana.  Parking: there is no parking on the street directly in front of the house. An alley runs beside the house and that is where guest parking is located. Please park close enough to the house so that cars can still get down the alley. Thanks!
transit: Within walking distance of downtown. The bus route is a couple blocks from the house.  UBER/LYFT.
access: The apartment is fully your own. You are welcome to use the washer and dryer just outside the apartment. If it's sunny outside and you'd like to sit outside you are welcome to make use of our front yard. In good weather, we have a couple of chairs out for that purpose.
interaction: As much or as little as you'd like. We want your stay to be as enjoyable as possible. If there is anything you need, we will be happy to accommodate. If you have any questions about Salem or things to do please feel free to ask.

name: Large Room and Bathroom with Separate Entrance!
summary: Very Private and Large Room and Bathroom with Separate Entrance!
space: Enjoy your privacy in our large master bedroom suite on the first floor of our townhouse! Have the whole first floor to yourselves (your private bedroom is the only room on the first floor of our home). This room has it's own private bathroom, large closet available for your use, and a separate private entrance that goes straight to the bedroom from the back of the house (see photos).  The private room has a queen size bed and a television for you to use. We do not have cable but we have Netflix for you to enjoy! (We currently do not have WiFi, but Netflix can be used with your own personal hot spot - sorry about this inconvinence right now)!  We also have a handful of DVD’s in your room for you to watch if you would like. There is also a queen sized air mattress in one of the closets in the private room for you to use if needed. We do have a washer and dryer on the third floor that is available for guests to use if they would like. On the second floor is a shared living room with a co

We do have a washer and dryer on the third floor that is available for guests to use if they
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood that our home is located in is an adorable, quiet, and safe townhome community in South Salem. It is a ten minuet walk to a fantastic food truck park with a very wide variety of delicious food options called Beehive Station, as well as a ten minuet walk to Safeway (and Starbucks) as well as a couple other fast food restaurants, bars, and chains (although you may not want to walk anywhere because much of the time it is raining here lol)! It is an under 5 minuet drive to 1-5 which makes it an easy drive to both Portland or Eugene (all freeway). We live right off of Commercial Street which is a long street that goes through Salem and has just about everything you might need (many different stores, restaurants, etc). We are a 45 minuet drive to the adorable shopping center Bridgeport Village, a 30 minuet drive to the Woodburn Outlets,  and a 15 minuet drive to downtown Salem. 15 minuet drive to the huge Riverfront Park as well as many other gorgeous walking parks around Sa
notes: We have street parking. Feel free to park either on our street (Blue River Dr) or on Madras Street. Do not park on any Ally street or your car will get towed.
transit: We live very close to a bus stop.
interaction: We have one very sweet cat named Francis who lives with us, but she stays out of the room that we rent out in case anyone is allergic! You will have your own key to the house. We are available for questions and can give suggestions on where to eat and what to see.
house_rules: - No shoes in the house please!

name: Willamette Valley Bungalow in Salem, Oregon
summary: Located within walking distance to beautiful Bush's Pasture Park, Minto Brown Island Park, Salem waterfront park, boutique shops, restaurants and grocery stores. .4 miles Acme Cafe .5 miles Roth's Fresh Markets 1.1 mile Bush Park 1.4 miles Minto Brown Island Park 1.7 miles Salem waterfront park .3 miles French Press Cafe
space: We are located in the heart of the Willamette Valley which means we are close to many fabulous wineries! The famous Willamette Valley Vineyard, with its gorgeous panoramic views, is located 4 miles down the road. During the spring and summer months, guests can enjoy a morning bike ride to Bush Park on our beach cruisers that we provide, then spend the afternoon wine tasting and finally wind down the evening while drinking a glass of our world famous Pinot Noir while relaxing in our Adirondack chairs next to a gas fireplace.There are so many things to appreciate in this valley and in this town: agriculture, viticulture, the natural wonder of Silver Creek Falls State Park, Pacific Northwest native plants, terrific hikes very close to town, the carousel and Riverfront Park. An added bonus for people traveling with their four legged friends is that the yard is fully enclosed. We accept up to 19 lbs dog. We have just remodeled and would appreciate letting us know. No cats.
description: Located within walking distance to beautiful Bush's Pasture Park, Minto Brown Island Park, Salem waterfront park, boutique shops, restaurants and grocery stores. .4 miles Acme Cafe .5 miles Roth's Fresh Markets 1.1 mile Bush Park 1.4 miles Minto Brown Island Park 1.7 miles Salem waterfront park .3 miles French Press Cafe We are located in the heart of the Willamette Valley which means we are close to many fabulous wineries! The famous Willamette Valley Vineyard, with its gorgeous panoramic views, is located 4 miles down the road. During the spring and summer months, guests can enjoy a morning bike ride to Bush Park on our beach cruisers that we provide, then spend the afternoon wine tasting and finally wind down the evening while drinking a glass of our world famous Pinot Noir while relaxing in our Adirondack chairs next to a gas fireplace.There are so many things to appreciate in this valley and in this town: agriculture, viticulture, the natural wonder of Silver Creek Falls State Par
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is walkable and the main house is a 10,000 sq ft lot with the cottage secure and quiet enclosed with secure gate all fenced in (2500 sq lot)with its own water and electricity and address. Mature pine trees and picnic table. Please ask for a bbq, we have several available treager, or gas.
notes: We offer a counter top induction stove, mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker. We have lots of details about the wine industry and hop yards.
transit: Walking to stores and wendys, is close. Five guys, acme cafe, jimmy johns, beer growler station. 250 yards. Willamet Valley Vineyard 4 miles away we can take you for free tastings, we are owners.
access: Guests will have full access to the cottage that has fully fenced yard.
interaction: (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) call or text. We enjoy visiting with the guests and if you need something please ask.
house_rules: - No shoes in house, quiet time 10pm to 7 am
host_about: We love to travel and try different food in the regions that we visit. We have experienced the Northwest from all over Southern Oregon to Northern Washington and what this area offers.  The Willamette Valley has offers some of the best wine in the world.

name: Sanctuary on High,  Downtown Salem
summary: Welcome to Sanctuary on High, a place to simply be as you are.  Beautifully renovated craftsman Colonial retaining the home's original architectural design. Classic charm, modern conveniences, located in the Historic Gaiety Hollow District. Walk to downtown, restaurants, coffee houses, entertainment, nearby Willamette University, Bush’s Nature Park.  All of Salem at your fingertips! No animals, smoking, vaping or mj. Limit 2 vehicles in driveway. Max 6 guests age 5 and over.
space: Excellent Wifi! Living Area:  Beautiful formal entry, original shuttered windows, family room with gas fireplace and dining with beautiful hardwood floors, original woodwork and lovely built-ins. Energy efficient heating and cooling. Full height basement includes game room, and laundry area including washer and two dryers.  Kitchen:  Newer stunning open gourmet kitchen with full length breakfast bar, convection oven with glass cooking surface, smooth quartz counters, all stainless steel appliances, cozy coffee bar. Bedrooms/Baths:  Spacious 3 bedrooms, 2.5 baths on two levels. All 3 bedrooms are on the second floor.   Luxurious master bedroom includes king size bed with outstanding Purple brand mattress and wall mounted smart tv. Private master bathroom includes large tiled walk-in shower.  Lots of light and windows, multiple closets, lovely sitting area and full length mirror. Middle bedroom also includes king size bed with outstanding Purple brand mattress and wall mounted smart tv.
description: Welcome to Sanctuary on High, a place to simply be as you are.  Beautifully renovated craftsman Colonial retaining the home's original architectural design. Classic charm, modern conveniences, located in the Historic Gaiety Hollow District. Walk to downtown, restaurants, coffee houses, entertainment, nearby Willamette University, Bush’s Nature Park.  All of Salem at your fingertips! No animals, smoking, vaping or mj. Limit 2 vehicles in driveway. Max 6 guests age 5 and over. Excellent Wifi! Living Area:  Beautiful formal entry, original shuttered windows, family room with gas fireplace and dining with beautiful hardwood floors, original woodwork and lovely built-ins. Energy efficient heating and cooling. Full height basement includes game room, and laundry area including washer and two dryers.  Kitchen:  Newer stunning open gourmet kitchen with full length breakfast bar, convection oven with glass cooking surface, smooth quartz counters, all stainless steel appliances, cozy coffee bar.
neighborhood_overview: One of only two historical districts in our city, staying in Gaiety Hollow is a rare opportunity.  This beloved neighborhood is located right on the edge of downtown.  You can walk to everything.... restaurants, bars, grills, coffee houses, every kind of shop you can think of, the State Capitol building, court house, Willamette University, Salem Hospital and even the famous River Park Carousel and Willamette Queen Sternwheeler (River Boat).  Walk to Riverfront Park where dozens of annual events take place including the Art Fair and Fish Fest Christian concerts.  Come stay with us!
notes: We have set up with the local dry cleaners to offer you discounts and even free pick up and delivery in a pinch!
transit: Getting around in Salem is super easy.  The location of Sanctuary on High is walking or wheeling distance to most of downtown.   You can rent a bike, a car or call a taxi or Uber. The public bus station and Amtrack train station are both right downtown as well.
access: Guests are welcome to all rooms on the property.
interaction: We want your stay to be fantastic and we try to be available at all times.  Feel free to call or text any time.  We will respond as quickly as possible.
house_rules: - To protect our license no events or parties or gatherings allowed. - No smoking of any kind on the property, including the yards.
host_about: Licensed Property Manager in Salem Oregon now offering  both short term and long term rentals!   Find me online at Susan Martin Property Management.

name: Near Downtown, Separate Guest House with Gate Code
summary: Mill Creek runs just outside your front window.  Watch the ducks swim by or the squirrels bounce through the leaves.  This crisp, clean 1 bedroom guest house is private & quiet. Covered & lighted concrete walkway from your car to the front door.   Free covered parking and just 5 minutes to downtown or I-5.   Includes super Wifi, device charging station, Qi wireless charging pad,  3 ways to make coffee, microwave, griddle, clothes iron and steamer,  stacked washer/dryer, king bed, and much more!
space: Crisp and clean with brand new furnishings, this adorable one bedroom guest house is hidden behind a privacy gate and open to huge span of Mill Creek.  Bedroom has  king size bed with Purple brand mattress!  Lots of cozy blankets and pillows make you want to just fall in and never get up.  Wall mount smart tvs and super wifi.  Kitchen has full size fridge, microwave, griddle, coffee maker and everything you need for a comfy stay.  (No stove/oven/dishwasher).  Counter height kitchen table perfect for sipping coffee while watching the creek run by.  Living room has couch and coffee table which lifts to desk height to double as a work space.  Ottoman offers curl up reading by day and fold out twin bed at night.  We even hung a guitar on the wall just for fun.   Inside the front door is a charging station for all your small devices.  Bathroom has glass shower and stocked with fluffy towels. First aid kit under the vanity.  Includes private washer and dryer! Free covered parking

neighborhood_overview: Post office is 5 blocks south. Costco and Walmart are 5 minutes east.  Downtown Salem with all of its amenities is west, only 5 minutes by car or walk it in about 12 blocks.  Even the Salem Airport is just a mile south.  Beautiful and historic downtown Salem has every kind of restaurant, coffee house, bar and grill you can think of.  Entertainment options from  movies and wine tasting to cake wars and car shows.  Visit our famous Historical districts and museums, Riverfront Park, The Carousel and the Willamette Queen Sternwheeler (River Boat).  And so much more!  Downtown Salem is super walkable or bikeable and popular with our state Capitol building, Willamette University, Salem Hospital and Bush's Nature Park.   A short car ride in any direction will take you to multiple water falls and hiking trails, wineries and glider rides.  A day trip will take you to to Oregon Coast Aquarium, Hatfield Marine Science Center, Seaside, OMSI Science Center, a Blazers game or skiing down Mt Hood.  T
notes: We've teamed up with a local dry cleaner to offer you a discount and even free pick up and delivery in a pinch!
transit: All kinds of options to get around from walking to taxi and Uber.  Rent a car or bring your own (only 1 parking space). You can even bring a bike.
access: Feel free to walk to the creek and watch wildlife in front of unit and on private door side of building.
interaction: I live on the property in another house.  Feel free to text or call if you need something!
house_rules: - No smoking, vaping or mj anywhere on the property. - No children under 12.  The creek is very close and fast moving. - Sorry, no animals of any kind.   I am allergic. - One vehicle max.

We are in the most desirable part of Salem- just a minuet to I-5, a minuet drive to just about everything you could need (food, shopping, businesses, etc). We are also a 10 to 15 minuet drive to Downtown Salem as well as an hour drive to both Portland and Eugene. We have a few gorgeous wineries very close by and a 40 minuet drive to the beach. There is a super cute food card station called “Beehive Station” that is just a 10 min walk away, and Safeway and Starbucks are both a 10 minuet walk away too.
notes: Park on our street (Blue River Dr). If there is no street parking available (at certain times of the day parking can be limited), then park on Madras Street. Just make sure that you do not park on any ally street or your car will get towed.
transit: Like we mentioned earlier, there are a few places you could walk to if you really want to but being in Oregon, much of the year it is raining. We have Uber and Lyft in Salem now and we also live right by a bus line.

name: Room Among the Trees
summary: Perfect for one or two guests.  Your room, with next-door private bath, is in its own separate part of my home. Enjoy your own sitting room and a patio surrounded by a sun-dappled woodland garden. You have your own secure space with separate entrance--sparkling clean with lots of special touches.  Please tell me something about yourself, and why you are coming to town!   (Fully licensed by City of Salem, compliant with safety codes.)
space: The bedroom has a queen bed, with simple linens, luggage racks, and ample closet space. Your bathroom has a tub/shower, toilet and basin. Toiletries, towels and dryer are provided. A private living area has cable television, mini-fridge, and coffee maker, snacks (granola bars, popcorn, yogurt), wonderful Nespresso coffee maker, an electric kettle, tea, teapot, cream and sweetener. This is a separate space (no one above or below you) with a locked door connecting to my part of the house. A patio outside your living room puts you in a woodland garden. You're welcome to use this space and the garden as your own.

neighborhood_overview: My place is three miles from downtown Salem, about an hour from Portland, and about an hour from the Oregon coast. Minto Brown Island Park, which borders the east bank of the Willamette River (1,200 acres of lush, natural open and wooded areas) is less than a mile away. You can walk, jog, or bike along 19 miles of hard and soft trails through native timber and grassy meadows.
access: You will enjoy the space and privacy of this two story suite. There is a  separate entrance through the garden. Please note that the walkway to the entrance is stone pavers, and there are stairs from the living room to the bedroom, so this space is not suitable for those with significant mobility challenges. You are welcome to park in front of the house.
interaction: I respect your privacy, and am glad to help you to get the most out of your visit. I may or may not be available to meet you on arrival.
house_rules: - I enjoy welcoming people of all cultures, religions, ethnicities and gender identities. - Check-in is flexible, usually 5PM-10PM. - No smoking. No pets. No parties or events. No drugs. No guest is to sleep overnight on the couch. No burning of candles or incense. - This is an entirely smoke-free property. - Only registered guests on premises. - Charge for lost key is $75. - Please feel free to come and go as you like, but please do so as quietly as possible for the peace of mind of my neighbors. I appreciate respect and care for my home, and ask that you leave it as you found it.
host_about: I have called many places in the US home. I enjoy creative cooking. My newest hobby is making jams and jellies from the wonderful fruit that grows in the Willamette Valley.  I love to garden, and to read  the treasures snagged on regular trips to Powell's. It's great living in Salem!
